31132.name: Jeu du Veldiv
31132.description: A French 1930s game, of which there were four versions. The first version only had 6 riders (one per team, no rules for team racing). Later versions had twelve riders (two per team). The cheaper versions had cardboard riders, the "deluxe" version had metal riders. Veldiv, short for Vélodrome d'Hiver (winter velodrome), was a very popular cycling track in Paris.

boardgamehonor.21774: 2008 UK Games Expo Best Boardgame Winner

31133.description:
Ice Flow is a strategic family game, interesting enough for gamers, as there are many tactical decisions to make.

Inspired by Karl Bushby's 1998 Goliath Expedition, players race their explorers across the Bering Strait from Alaska to Siberia - riding ice floes, dodging polar bears, and collecting useful items on the way. Thus, at its heart, Ice Flow is a resource management game coupled with a traveling salesman type problem where the ground (or ice) is constantly moving.

Each player has three explorers and rucksack card (to store a limited amount of rope and fish in). The board consists of an array of hexagonal spaces with ice floes (hexagonal plastic tiles) that are introduced at the top and can be moved down the board by players with rates dependent on where they are on the board. On their turn players must first move, rotate or introduce a new ice floe, then they can move one of their explorer as far as they can (or want) before collecting an item from the tile they finished on. When moving, explorers are limited by the obstacles they must overcome and the tools they have available. For example, the ice floes have smooth sides and rough side: the rough sides depict "pack ice" which is hard to cross, and costs a rope. Similarly, explorers can swim up to one space, but that costs a fish as swimming through arctic waters is energy sapping. Polar bears are also a hazard that must be avoided or lured away with fish; beware they can be lured away from one player straight into the path of another!

The winner is the first player to negotiate all the hazards and arrive in Siberia with his three explorers intact.

Not to be confused with: IceFloe
31133.name: Ice Flow

31134.name: Land's End to John O'Groats
31134.description: Vintage simple British cycling game released in the '40s and named after the longest possible trajectory in Great Britain.

31135.description: Themed Cycling game (Donald Duck theme) released by a company from Berlin in 1998. Basically it's a simple roll & move game with card board riders.
31135.name: Tour de Duck

31136.name: 1 vs. 100 Board Game
31136.description:
From the box: It's you against the mob in the most exciting trivia game ever.

Contents: 275 question cards (825 questions), card holder, wipe-off mob board with stand, 51 mob tokens, 4 cardboard shields, 5 answer photos, 3 answer cards, wipe-off money board, score pad, wipe-off pen, and instructions

Gameplay: One player is the contestant. The other player(s) become the mob. The mob divides one hundred mob tokens as evenly as possible. One mob player, acting as host, reads a question and its three possible answers aloud. The mob players use their tokens to secretly choose one or more answers.

When the mob players have finished distributing all of their tokens, the contestant may ask for one of three helps before giving a response to the question. The helps one response of the contestant’s choosing), Trust the Mob (the contestant is forced to choose whichever response has the most tokens on it) or Ask the Mob (this eliminates one wrong response). The contestant can use each help only once.

If the contestant gives the correct response, the money is added to the bank equal to the level the player is on multiplied by the number of tokens the mob has put on the wrong responses. The levels start at $1000 and ascend to $10,000. The mob tokens that are on the incorrect responses are out of play.

The game is over when the contestant gives an incorrect response. This means the money in the bank is divided among the mob players who still have tokens. The contestant wins $1,000,000 when the mob loses all its tokens. The contestant can quit the game before ascending to the next level and keep whatever money has been accumulated in the bank.

Players continue the game until each player has been the contestant. A running total of the scores of each game is kept. The player with the highest score is the winner.

Considering that the television series uses 101 contestants, this is reasonable faithful translation of the television series.

Intended for 2 - 4 players Ages 12 and up

31137.description:
Travel around the board buying your favorite landmarks from the movie Shrek 2. The game is over when one player runs out of money.

For 2 - 4 players Ages 5 and up
31137.name: Monopoly Junior: Shrek 2

31138.name: Amazing Space Venture
31138.description:
Amazing Space Venture is a clever tile and card-playing board game of intergalactic space exploration.

You are an astronaut in the future competing to discover the most valuable planets and biggest star systems in this exciting and delightful game that combines three familiar game mechanics into one elegant retro-60's gaming experience. Strategic tile-placement, point-to-point movement, and clever use of cards enable you to build your own constantly expanding universe on a large-as-space-itself 23-1/2" x 33" game board. Create and probe new galaxies, position and maneuver space ships and UFOs, build space stations, meet other space explorers, and discover distant planets with strange environments and mysterious life forms. At any time, space pirates, black holes, supernovas, space monsters, and other special action events can help or hinder your efforts to become Lord of the Universe.
For more information, contact Steve LeShay at 12412 SE 174th Loop, Summerfield, FL 34491 or via Shercogames@hotmail.com

31139.name: El joc de l'especulador
31139.description:
El Joc de l'Especulador is a card game based in other games like Mafia, Werewolf, etc. In this edition the action takes place in a city where corrupted businessmen want to take control of the city by buying the citizen's estates.

The game is published under a Creative Commons license, and was distributed for free from the web page of the editor. Check the links for the instructions and cards!

31140.name: The Fraggle Trap Game
31140.description:
The Fraggle Trap Game is based on the characters from Fraggle Rock, a children's television series from the 1980's. The series was created by Jim Henson, primarily featuring a cast of Muppet creatures called Fraggles.
Fraggles are always hungry - the object of the game is to feed your Fraggles with as many radishes as possible by collecting them from the Gorg's radish patch & bringing them to your corner.

An entirely different game from MB's 'Fraggle Rock'.

Fantastic memories !!!

Dance your cares away,
Worry's for another day.
Let the music play,
Down at Fraggle Rock !

Work your cares away,
Dancing's for another day.
Let the Fraggles play,
We're Gobo, Mokey, Wembley, Boober, Red.

Dance your cares away,
Worry's for another day.
Let the music play,
Down at Fraggle Rock !

31141.name: Wrinkles in Time
31141.description:
based on description from Angel Fire Site:

Two player card game based on the Time Quartet series of books by Madeleine L’Engle.
One player is the side of Good.
The other player is the side of Evil.

SETUP
Each player begins in possession of 3 Balance Tokens.

TURN SEQUENCE
Each turn has 10 phases:
Destiny Phase I
Fate Phase I
Challenge Phase I
Destiny Phase II
Fate Phase II
Challenge Phase II
Destiny Phase III
Fate Phase III
Challenge Phase III
Test Phase

DESTINY PHASES
Each player draws 7 cards from his deck.
If a Deck runs out, shuffle the discard and draw from it.

VICTORY
The First player to be in control of all 6 Balance Tokens is the winner.

31142.name: 1558: Hanfrieds Erbe
31142.description:
The players are brought into the year 1558 and face each other as citizens and students. With strategy and a little luck they try to push through their interests in the blossoming university town of Jena.
Designer Prof. Ingo Althöfer developed “1558 - Hanfrieds inheritance” exclusively for the Jenaer university's 450 year anniversary. A short game, not only for the break between two lectures. Printed on ecological hemp cloth. Unusually packed in a silver aluminum cylinder. Limited Edition.

The special reason for using hemp cloth for the board was a word joke (hemp = Hanf in German): Hanfried == Han(f)fried == Hanf-Fried. The price of the game was exactly 15.58 Euro, motivated by the year 1558 when Jena University was founded.
Information from the designer: I realized one very personal copy with wooden board (instead of hemp cloth) where the (neutral) Hanfried piece is a real silver coin. Two pictures of this item are found in the picture gallery.

31143.name: Michael Bully Herbig Spiel: Trilogie
31143.description:
This game offers at least for the fan of the Munich comedian genuine cult potential. In funny small dialog , which originate partially from the feather/spring from Bully Herbig, a search term is replaced in the text by the word “Bully”. While a player reads out the texts, the others must try to guess the term. This guessing takes place into four steps, trying to encircle the term a bit in each round. Amazing what (wrong) associations some first references may lead to.
While this first part of the game is strictly played in sequence, as soon as someone says the correct answer the game changes into chaotic action.
The so-called riddle master must try to catch with a cup the figures of the others, which stand in the center of the game board. They try to pull fast enough the cord and thus theirs figures of the board, otherwise point loss.
This odd mixture of knowledge and dexterity, has even something from the parodic humor of the Bully films.
Two long-proved mechanisms are connected here in new and unusual way to an entertaining game.

31144.name: Kahootz
31144.description: Introducing... The sound making, second-hand drawing, tongue twisting, face making, people directing, acting out, gut busting, laugh so hard that you cry, one of a kind, gotta have it, more fun than you ever had playing with your friends and family hoot of a charades game!

31145.name: Are You Smarter Than a 5th Grader?

boardgamefamily.10573: TV Series: Are You Smarter Than a 5th Grader?

31145.description:
From Hasbro:

Now you can bring the hit TV quiz show home! Find out if you make the grade!

Play the game that pits the kids against the grownups for ultimate bragging rights. All you have to do to claim victory is answer 11 questions that the average 5th grader knows.

Sounds like child's play, but would you know...

Which U.S. President is featured on the face of a nickel?
What is the heaviest land animal?
What geologic era are we in right now?
A decagon has how many sides?

...or would you need to "cheat" off a classmate to answer correctly?

You may not have all the answers, but know you'll either walk away with the $1,000,000 prize or have to admit, "I am not smarter than a 5th grader."

Object: Be first to win a million dollars! If no player reaches the Million Dollar level, the
player with the most money wins the game.

Contents:

300 Question cards
Card Reader Sleeve
2 Gameboards
4 Money Marker Pawn
10 Grade Markers
2 "Cheat" Pawns
1 "Save" Pawn
12 $1,000 Tokens
Pad and Pencils
card tray

31146.name: Mixed Pickles
31146.description:
Simple word game in which players create silly sentences from phrases on cards. Example:

I'm always in for

Hunting buffalo

At a wedding

Leading to outrageous fun at the turn of the century.

31147.name: Grandmama's Improved Game of Riddles
31147.description: Simple party game, whoever answers the most riddles wins. Example: What word is that to which, if you add a syllable, will make is shorter? Answer: Short.

31148.description:
(From the publishers web site)
Primera Batalla, the Spanish Civil War supplement for Disposable Heroes and Coffin for Seven Brothers.

This book contains information on the various factions, and the artillery, vehicles, and aircraft they employed.
31148.name: Primera Batalla

31150.name: The Bachelorette Party Game
31150.description:
From the publisher: "It’s the bride’s last chance to play before the fateful day and there’s no better way to kick off her special party than The Bachelorette Party Game, the ultimate party game for wild women only. But beware! This game contains some very personal questions that are guaranteed to reveal everything you never wanted to know about your best girlfriends… and yourself."

Players roll and move around a board and answer personal questions which are very adult in nature. Includes specially shaped game board, Game booklet with over 150 questions, pawns, die, and 54 "Beefcake" cards.

31151.name: The Picnic Game
31151.description: The object of The Picnic Game is to be the first player to set their place and gather all the food. Players take turns spinning a spinner and collecting the items they need for the picnic (including a main dish, a vegetable, a fruit, a drink, a dessert, a plate, a napkin & utensils, and a picnic blanket. There is something of an order in which the items need to be collected, but if the spinner stops on the ants, a player must give back an item. The pieces of the game are made of laminated chipboard and the artwork is very appealing for younger children.

31152.name: The Game of Psych-Out
31152.description: The Game of Psych-Out is a personality/psychological themed party game. Players answer a series of questions designed to evoke revealing information about their personalities and then try to guess which other players provided the answers to the questions.

31153.name: Gimme A Ruling
31153.description:
Gimme A Ruling is a golf-themed sports trivia/question and answer game that focuses on the rules of golf. The game contains 550 questions that present actual on-the-course situations and challenges the players to provide the correct ruling. (The situations, questions and rulings presented on the game cards are taken directly from the book, Decisions on the Rules of Golf, as published by the USGA together with the Royal and Ancient of St. Andrews, Scotland.) The winner of the game is the player with the lowest score after 18 holes/questions.

Game includes: 550 question/answer cards, 3 20-sided dice: 1 Category, 1 Birdie, 1 Bogey, 2 official score pads, and 2 golf pencils

31154.name: Kerala
31154.description: Kerala is a race game from Asia. Two or three players move their five pieces around a course, dictated by the throws of five cowrie shells. The board consists of a square perimeter track and three "runways" approaching a corner, through which pieces enter and exit the board. The object of the game is to be the first to move one's pieces onto the board via a runway, around the course to the centre, around the course again and bear off via the runway.

31156.name: Presidents I Card Game
31156.description:
60-card deck featuring the outstanding achievements and brief biographical history of each President of the United States from Washington to Pierce.

The object of the game is to obtain complete books (set of 4 presidents) by calling for cards from other players. When a player gets a complete book of 4, he lays it aside; when all the cards have been gathered into books, the game is over and the player with the most books wins.

31157.name: Alice in Wonderland
31157.description:
Each player chooses a character, each of which are double-sided. One side is BIG in which case you move forward, and the other side is SMALL, in which case you move backwards.
Players move up the board similar to Snakes & Ladders but with the added excitement of extras like the Looking Glass & the Jabberwocky square.

Contents

1 x Playing Board
6 x Double-sided counters
1 x Looking glass counter
1 x Die
1 x Die cup
Rules in box lid ( English, French & Dutch)

31158.name: Terminated
31158.description:
From the publisher's web site:
The board game Terminated was the brainchild of the experiences of its creator. After more than a decade of employment in different companies and industries, different departments and sectors of the businesses, from agriculture to software production, I realized that at the end of the day, one common factor was evident; the desire for career advancement and the fruits and privileges that accompanied the advancement. To me, everything seemed to revolve around this common factor, Advancement; the economy, lifestyle and life in general all seemed to be a game where the rules were already written and I had to follow them.

With this understanding in mind, I embarked on the arduous task of arranging it all on paper and it wasn’t long before I had a complete and playable game. The circular design of the game was chosen to emphasize the revolving aspect of the game. I had four gas stations to remind us of both the need for gas and the high gas prices. I included childcare; a common denominator in our families and most other successful and complete families. Since we all have to pay taxes, I included a slot for the IRS on the game. It was abundantly clear that since I got paid once every pay period, then one complete revolution around the board was equivalent to one complete pay period. Domestic utilities were also included in the game for this was an everyday necessity.

There were several things I could have included in the game such as food and health insurance but I ran out of room. However, I did include vacation, a common phenomenon at work, whether earned or incidental such as sick time or penalty (suspensions). The Superior Court was included to provide a platform for one to forward his/ her grievances and concerns and to provide a platform for one to mount their best defense whenever the circumstance arose.

For disciplinary purpose and as an instrument of the constant penalty awaiting the lawbreakers, I included the jail slot on the game. I also included the INS slot on the game due to the fact that there are numerous undocumented immigrants who masquerade as legal entities hence the need for consistently proving ones eligibility for employment. As much as I despise paying the high insurance premiums, the state law requires that we maintain auto insurance at all times. In an effort to keep the game fun and entertaining, I included the mailbox and email as tools to deliver messages, promotions, bonus, and even penalties.

The eight departments, Shipping and Receiving, Production, Assembly, Customer Service, Packaging, Maintenance, Quality Assurance and Management were chosen because I had personal experience in them and I felt that they were crucial to any manufacturing enterprise. Other departments such as accounting, advertising and marketing though important to a company were not included because I figured that some companies were able to operate profitably by either doubling or outsourcing these departments.

31159.name: Piratatak
31159.description:
The objective of the game is to construct your own ship before pirates arrive and attack you!

The basic mechanic is to draw cards to found gold (for buy ship cards to your opponents), ship cards (for construct your own ship),cannons (for attack pirates if they appear) but if you draw a pirate card you lose 3 cards! You may know when to stop.

Components 55 cards (9 cards are pirates)

31160.name: Krazy Golf
31160.description: Plays 18 holes of golf with cards.

31161.name: Monopoly: Michael Graves Design
31161.description: Michael Graves retools the classic game with a new look. Includes 12 hotels, 32 houses and 6 Michael Graves Monopoly tokens. Tokens include desk clock, desk lamp, suitcase, teapot, blender, and, toaster. Houses and Hotels are made of rubber and the board has a silvery prismatic finish. The money is semi see-through (almost like a parchment paper). All of the pieces store neatly in a plastic cast that slides into its own carrying case. The game fully stored measures 14 inches length x 8.5 inches width x 3.5 inches height. Great for travel!

31163.name: The Sociable Telephone
31163.description: A game designed to teach proper social interaction, players connected by a "phone" pose questions that are answered by phrases on the game cards.

31164.name: What's His Name?
31164.description: An early trivia game, each card has questions about three men who share the first letter of their last names. For instance one card has questions on Shakespeare, Stanley, and Scott. Typical question: R-A famous Dutch artist born 1607, died 1669. Answer: Rembrandt. (You knew that, right?)

31165.name: Chamber
31165.description:
A game done by Ravensburger as a merchandising game for the Handelskammer Hamburg. Ages 12 and up
Consists of
1 board
200 cards
200 stocks
315 playing money
1 die
some wooden game pieces

31166.name: Concentra Spiel
31166.description:
This game war released approx. in the mid 1960s by Verlag Hoppenstedt from Darmstadt/Germany as a merchandising game for the Dresder Bank AG. The name Concentra is the name of a big German investment fund and the game leads players to learn about investing and divesting with stocks.

Up to 8 players move around the board three times. The player with the most money wins the game. Movement is determined by a die. In the first round, if a player gets on a green space, he gets the corresponding bond. At the roll of a 6 he gets a Concentra-Fund unit. In the second and third round, a player who gets on a green space has to pay the owner of the corresponding bond and a dividend for the Concentra-Fund. At the end of the game the dividend is divided among the fund owners.

31167.description:
Phil Barker's Horse, Foot, Gun is a set of tabletop rules that is based on the same system as De Bellis Antiquitatis and its successors. It covers the period from 1701 to 1915.

Re-implements:

De Bellis Antiquitatis
De Bellis Multitudinis
Hordes of the Things
De Bellis Renationis
31167.name: Horse, Foot and Guns

31168.name: Hand of Fate Fortune Telling Game
31168.description: A simple trivia game with three kinds of questions: identify the picture, put a series of related historic events in chronological order, and true or false. The "hand of fate" is the spinner that points to a question on the board. The game does not actually seem to have any relation to fortune telling.

31169.name: Deals on Wheels
31169.description:
In this game each player represents an enterprising transporter. The object of the game is to be the first to earn either E500,000 in the short game, or E1,000,000 in the standard game.

Players earn money by transporting cargo in their trucks between European cities. You can invest the money earned, buy more trucks or bigger ones, or increase the radius of your deliveries.

Actions available each turn depend upon the roll of the dice. Actions include taking a chance card, taking a cargo card and auctioning it, driving the trucks or refueling.

31170.name: Hide Away
31170.description:
Be the first to bury all of your Burying pieces!

Lift a Crown to bury one of your pieces. Play moves clockwise and each player does the same. If you uncover a Burying piece, add it to your supply. Revolve the tray as far as you like during your own turn. Bury all of your Burying pieces and be the winner!

31171.name: Travellers Trivia
31171.description: Each player takes a score sheet. High roller starts. Players are asked questions corresponding to the die number rolled each turn, scoring one point if correct. A bonus question may be asked if available. If a player answers 6 questions in a row correctly, a bonus of 2 is scored. The game ends when one player scores in all 6 rows. Highest score wins.

31172.name: Round Britain Trivia
31172.description:
There are three variants that can be played.

Game 1, as individuals, players take it in turns to be the question master for one card each. Highest score wins.

Game 2, as individuals, each player rolls a die and is asked the question on the card by the player to the right. Play passes to the right. Highest score after an agreed number of rounds wins.

Game 3, in two equal teams, each player in the team will receive a question and decide whether to answer individually, (scoring two points,) or to confer, (scoring one point.) The team with the highest score after an agreed number of rounds wins.

31173.name: The Teachers Game
31173.description:
The teachers game consists of four different, all slightly silly, but entertaining games, based around school room subjects. The aim of the game is to score more points on your School Report Card than any other pupil.'

English questions involve completing a phrase using an adjective beginning with a particular letter without repeating a word already used or hesitating for more than 10 seconds.

Geography questions involve naming a country, town, river, or state that begins with the last letter of the name of the country on the question card.

Maths questions involve arriving at a given number using four other numbers also given and multiplying, adding, subtracting, or dividing.

Art questions involve choosing a word from a card and communicating the word by drawing on a pad.

31174.name: Operations Room
31174.description: A very easy game about the Battle of Britain, included in the central pages of "The Battle of Britain Project Book" printed for the Royal Air Force Museum in the 50th anniversary of the event. On a squared map representing Northern France, the Channel and Southern England, the German player moves 10 bombers and 15 fighters against the 25 fighters of the RAF. Aim of the German is to destroy all the 11 British airfields and then do a successful raid against London.

31175.name: Farm Management
31175.description:
The players are farm owners in the rural United States of the 1960s. By growing crowing crops, raising cattle, selling grain, and efficiently managing resources, farm owners strive to have the wealthiest (or least in debt) farm at the end of three years.

The game is presented as a farm simulator, designed to help farmers learn more about the business of farming and train them to make successful business decisions. Many of the instructions are actually advice that could be applied towards running a real farm, and the box cover advertises, "Test Farm Plans, Teach Better Management, Learn Farming Methods".

Preliminary list of components (based on 2 game sets):
1 game set up sheet
6 Farm layout sheets
1 plastic tray insert for game box
1 guide for plastic tray set up
12 International Harvester Blue Ribon cards
16 barn addition cards
12 tractor cards
72 machinery cards (6 each of disk harrow, plow, baler, drill, mower, combine, planter, chopper, cultivator, rake, corn picker, peg tooth harrow)
72 crop cards (12 each of oats, wheat, corn, soybeans, hay and silage corn)
6 unfinished work cards
22 “200 bu. Corn” cards
24 “1000 bu. Corn” cards
28 “200 bushels oats” discs
25 “1000 bushels oats” discs
20 “200 bushels wheat” discs
20 “1000 bushels wheat” discs
16 “200 bushel soybeans” discs
16 “1000 bushels soybeans” discs
20 “10 ton hay” cards
28 “50 ton hay” cards
20 “50 ton silage” discs
10 “500 ton silage” discs
18 “30 beef calves” cards
18 “30 beef yearlings” cards
18 “10 dairy cow” cards
6 rations cards
48 chore cards
7 $20000 bank note cards
6 $10000 bank note cards
6 $5000 bank note cards
6 hail insurance policy cards
1 master control box
84 red plastic domes
34 $10 bills
24 $20 bills
15 $50 bills
60 $100 bills
17 $500 bills
62 $1000 bills
17 $5000 bills.

31176.name: Bluff Mania
31176.description:
Players take turns to pick a card, and play continues clockwise. One of the three words is chosen by the active player who reads it out. All write down an ingenious, unlikely or just plain silly definition.

The active player reads out all the definitions including the correct one. All other players decide what they think is the correct definition. Each player who chooses the correct definition scores a point. Authors of fictional definitions that are chosen also receive a point for each player who chose it.

The winner is the player with the most points after twenty rounds.

31177.name: Onnimanni
31177.description:
Your opponent has placed a treasure under the pictures. Your job is to find out where it is!
By making clever questions you get clues where to find the treasure. But it's not so simple the opponent can only answer yes or no to your questions and the amount of questions is also limited.

31178.name: Groeninghe Velt 1302 Guldensporenslag
31178.description: The Flemish have beaten the French in a battle that took place on 11 July 1302 in the neighborhood of Kortrijk (Belgium). Groeninghe Velt brings you back to the time of crossbows, cavalry and man to man fights.

31179.name: Diagnostic
31179.description:
A rally through Europe. Each player drives his car from Geneva to Paris. On their trip, players need to answer questions on car technique. When questions are answered incorrectly, their car is broke and needs help from the road-service cars.

Educational game on car technique

31180.description:
Hohenfriedeberg is a free little wargame about the Battle of Hohenfriedeberg, which took place in 1745 during the Second Silesian War between Prussia and Austria.
The rules are inspired by and based on Postcard from the Revolution.

It can be downloaded directly from the files section of this page.
31180.name: Hohenfriedeberg

31181.name: Column, Line, and Square
31181.description: Column Line And Square (CLS) is a game of war set in the period of Napoleon (1808-1815).

31182.name: New Game of Familiar Quotations from Popular Authors
31182.description: Similar to the game Authors, each card features 5 quotations from a single author. Quotations are read until someone guesses the author correctly.

31183.name: Gems of Art
31183.description: This game features many pieces of great art, which can be used to play 5 different games. In reality, it's like playing authors with art.

31186.name: Grandmama's New Testament Questions & Answers
31186.description: Typical Q&A card game for children.

31187.name: Grandmama's Geographical Game
31187.description: Typical Q&A card game featuring world geography.

31188.name: Yankee Doodle: A Game of American History
31188.description: Typical roll-and-move Q&A game, questions range from the Boston Tea Party of 1773 to the World's Columbian Exposition aka The White City in 1893.

31190.name: Young Folks Historical Game
31190.description: Typical Q&A game focused on American history for children. As it was made around the turn of the last century, children were actually expected to know some history, like details of the American Civil War and "recent" history, like the building of the Brooklyn Bridge.

31191.name: Megamaniology
31191.description:
From the box:

"Ever wanted to be an evil genius, but lacked that degree in nuclear warping from a shady South American university? Now is your chance! Gather your body parts, chemicals and duct tape, stick your brain in a jar, and get to work with your deformed helper on that mind control beam you've wanted since high school gym class!"

Megamaniology is a simple card game about collecting ingredients to make the best experiment ever! First player to 23 points wins the game.

31192.name: Foster's Home For Imaginary Friends Corridor Chaos Board Game
31192.description:
from back of game "Help Mac and Blooregard find 5 imaginary friends within the winding halls of Madame Foster's Mansion! Flip hallway tiles to reveal hidden characters. The first player to reach 5 imaginary friends wins!"
Contents= 1 game board, 2 movers, 16 path tiles, 4 command tiles, 15 imaginary friend cards, 1 die, instructional sheet.

31193.name: Ballbuster
31193.description:
Ballbuster: A Game of Skill for Two Players

Object: The first player to form a row of six of his/her marbles is the winner.

A fast-paced game of skill and chance for two players.

Ballbuster features an original red plastic 3 dimensional game-board with special chutes to transport marbles between players.

Players begin the game with a set of marbles and a pair of dice. Rolling the dice in turn, players place marbles strategically to either make a row or block the other player.

The game can be won in three rolls of the dice, or it can last up to 20 minutes.

31194.name: Goldmine Trails
31194.description:
Goldmine Trails - A Wood Building Game

"The Fun of a game... The challenge of a construction kit... The reward of accomplishment... All in one set."

Players roll the die, then add, subtract or move the wooden trail-building pieces accordingly. The object is to construct a trail on each turn so that the gold rolls successfully from the entrance of the trail to the red miners' pan at the end of the trail. The first player to collect 10 gold pieces wins!

31195.name: BattleBox: American Civil War
31195.description:
Like all the Battle Box series, the American Civil War is an entry level game designed to bridge the gap between board gaming and miniature gaming for the young general in training.

The game comes with a game board, 20 detailed playing figures, dice, one page rules, and turn track/marker. It is a straight forward game with simple mechanics that allow quick and amusing play anywhere anytime.

31197.name: Condomania 2000
31197.description:
Players start with $1,000,000 to buy Condominiums at exorbitant prices. Players attempt to buy the properties offering the highest return on their investment, and to own an entire block in order to double their rental income.

Players may gamble at the racetrack. They receive money each time they pass the employment office. They pay a fine or collect a bonus each time they pass the management office or the boardroom. They hit the jackpot when they land in the Country Club.

The game involves luck and management of finances.

Published in Scarborough, Ontario, Canada.

Also available in French.

31198.description:
War at Sea is the classic game designed by John Edwards of Jedko Games and entrusted to L2 Design Group to reproduce this fine classic game in the custom you are used to from L2 Design Group.

A naval simulation of the Second World War naval battles in the Atlantic Ocean and the Mediterranean Sea, this game has all the big battleships and carriers of the belligerent sides. True to the original game, War at Sea has a one piece die cut map on heavy board, all the classic rules and the most recent rules used in Tournament play at WBC. Counters are 5/8" x 1.25" in size and hit markers are 5/8". Orders of battle are given for the British, German, Russian, French, Italian and United States Navies.

War at Sea is the first of 3 planned games, the Atlantic, the Pacific and a linking game. Counters for War at Sea have variant RAIDER backs on them, NOT used in this game, but consistent with the entire Victory at Sea system. Almost every variant counter known has been included with the counter mix including:

• Frogmen
• French Navy
• 1 Factor Air Power
• The Kirov, the Argus and more.
• Force G, Gibraltar Naval Guns and English Channel mines
• Admirals
and more!
31198.name: War at Sea (third edition)

31199.name: The New Pilgrim's Progress
31199.description: Based on the book by John Bunyan, players move through life dodging sins and other dangers, like the Castle of Giant Despair, while trying to make it across the River of Death to the Celestial City.

31200.name: Peter Peter Pumpkin Eater
31200.description: A very simple roll-and-move children's game in which the the object is to move through a maze to the pumpkin.

31201.name: Jack the Giant Killer
31201.description: Looks almost the same as McLoughlin Brothers' Little Red Riding Hood that came out the same year. A roll-and-move game in which Jack must overcome 7 obstacles to win.

31202.name: Little Red Riding Hood
31202.description: Little Red Riding Hood dodges the wolf as she makes her way through the forest.

31203.name: Little Goldenlocks and the Three Bears: A Pleasing Game
31203.description: A simple roll-and-move children's game, with chances for advancement and pitfalls like Snakes & Ladders.

31204.description:
The Color-Matching Carousel Game

"As soon as a player gives the Strawberryland Character Cards a spin on the Berry-Go-Round, everyone tries to make them stop. If a player is lucky, the card that lands in front of her will match a picture on her game board. Players then try to match all the pictures on their boards. When they do, they'll be ready for the most important part of all--capturing the Purple Pieman! The first one to do it wins the game."
31204.name: Strawberry Shortcake Berry-Go-Round

31205.description:
Simple Tactical level Board & card game for 2 players. Simulate battles between two small fleets of Greek style Warships. Each figure represents a single Ship. No dice. Use cards to move, attack, and defend. A complete copy of the rules are available for free at:
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/Periplus.html
31205.name: Periplus

31206.name: Punic Wars Combined Arms
31206.description:
Punic Wars Combined Arms is a tactical level Boardgame for 2 players. One will be Hannibal and his Punic forces trying to overtake Scipio and his Roman army. No cards or Dice are used, rather, pieces have Chess like movements with application of Force at a distance. Different Units have different abilities per their historical counterparts. Lead your Cohorts to Victory! A complete copy of the rules are available for free at:
http://www.angelfire.com/games2/warpspawn/PWCA.html

31207.name: King of Cash
31207.description:
The King of Cash is the first player to buy the "big six" assets: house, car, boat, furniture, audio visual equipment and clothing.

To generate the money to buy the "big six", players buy, run and sell companies. If another player lands on your company, they pay you for purchases.

There are 12 different industries with three companies in each industry. The more companies you own, the more money you make. Build factory outlets and coin maximum cash.

Try your luck and win cash by playing "rawlette", "play & win" and "dice & win".

The game's playing cards, "gatvol" ("fed-up") and "lekker" ("nice"), provide players the opportunity to lose or earn money based on typical South African occurrences.

31208.name: Word of Mouth
31208.description:
Waddingtons Word of Mouth: A quick-witted word game of imagination and bluff.

From the back of the box:

Word of Mouth is a modern variation of an old game in which players select obscure words from the dictionary and try to make up bluff definitions. In Word of Mouth, the fun has been enhanced as players must place their best on the one definition they feel fits the "official" definition. The first player to fill his/her home base with betting chips wins, so that the name of the game is to come up with the most believable sounding definition, be it fact of fiction.

The beauty of this game is that it isn't necessarily for high-brows. If a player's vocabulary knowledge is shaky but his imagination and bluffing skills are tops, he could easily win the game by persuading the other players to pass their betting chips his way.

31209.description:
Ramirez Sergio Delastillas is a decorated Union soldier and a specialist in traps.

Each individually packaged figure includes a pre-painted plastic model, reference card, cardboard tokens, and an introductory scenario. A copy of Tannhäuser is required to play.
31209.name: Tannhäuser: Ramirez

31210.description:
The mercenary Gorgei hails from Russia, the land explored in the forthcoming Tannhauser expansion Project Novgorod.

Each individually packaged figure includes a pre-painted plastic model, reference card, cardboard tokens, and an introductory scenario. A copy of Tannhäuser is required to play
31210.name: Tannhäuser: Gorgeï

31211.name: Our Town Sparkles / Social Responsibility Game
31211.description:
These are a couple of games, made in Singapore, which come together in the same box. The objectives of these two games are to inculcate good social behaviors and habits.

The eponymous Our Town Sparkles is a simple roll and move boardgame. The first player to get to the end of the track by exact count wins. The Social Responsibility Game has a circular track (in the sense that you go round and round the track) and players follow instructions on the board where their pieces land. There are Social Responsibility Quotient (SRQ) cards worth up to 20 SRQ points. Players can also earn and lose money depending on their social behavior. There are red penalty cards, drawn when a player lands on a 'Penalty Square', and green cards that a player picks up after landing on a 'Good Social Habit Square'. The game ends when a player runs out of money, or there are no more SRQ point cards. The player with the most SRQ points wins. A curious feature of the game is the role of Social Responsibility Judege (SRJ) - the SRJ administers all penalties, rewards or awards.

Graphics and illustrations by Rolling Art Pte Ltd.
The year of publication is based on a discount coupon (for Popular Bookstore) that came with the game and was valid only till October 2005.

A version of this game, called Tampines Our Pride, combining the Social Responsibility Game and Tampines Our Pride Game (a roll-and-move game, like the Our Town Sparkles Game) was created for the Tampines Town Council. The differences are in the roll-and-move game (different track and events) and the Social Responsibility Game has some slightly different artwork - for example, there's a picture of the Tampines Changkat Community Club on the board. The board itself is made from cardboard and not as thick as the mounted board used in Our Town Sparkles.

31212.name: 1,000 Drinking Games
31212.description:
From the Manufacturer:

1,000 Drinking Games combines rounds of classic and new drinking games with off-the-wall plot twists and a variety of drink assignments. This set includes all of the popular drinking concepts: dice games, card games, word games, tongue twisters, spinner games, categories, ranking-based games, etc. Players can enjoy their favorite games over and over or learn a new game each time they play! Includes: 10 Game Concept Cards, 10 Plot Twist Cards, 10 Next Round Cards, 1 Categories Card, 1 Tongue Twisters Card, 11 Numerical Rank Cards, 2 CHUG! Cards, 1 Spinner, 2 Regular Dice, 1 Drink Assignment Die, and EASY-TO-FOLLOW Instructions.

Ages 21 and up.

31213.name: Country Club Golf Game
31213.description: Country Club Golf Game - The Board Game (Deluxe Edition) is a simulation of an 18-hole golf game. It utilizes a double sided write-on/wipe-off game board, showing 9 "holes" on each side. Players use a direction indicator template and a club selector table to figure out where their ball lands, then mark that spot on the board with a grease pencil.

31215.name: The Name's The Game
31215.description:
A deck of cards and card game built around a name. Each set is built around a different forename.
Names available; Andrew, Anthony, Christopher, Daniel, David, George, James, John, Mark, Matthew, Michael, Paul, Peter, Richard, Robert, Stephen, Thomas, William.
Each card contains the name and brief summary of the life a famous person whose forename matches the deck. The cards are dealt and players compete to arrange their name cards in the correct chronological sequence, by using the character information on their cards.
If the other players are satisfied that the cards are in the correct sequence the player may take an additional card.
The first player to correctly sequence six cards is the winner.

31216.description:
Whack a Catgirl is a card game with a simple concept. Neko-chan, the catgirl, is cute! Therefore she must be pelted with various objects. Plushies, buckets of water, other fangirls, you name it! You choose cards through a simple continuous draft mechanic to build an arsenal of items. Items are used both to throw at the catgirl (to score points!) and to use as bait to lure her over. Players go through the entire deck of cards once, and whomever has the most points at the end is the Champion of Everything. And you want that.

All cards feature humorous flavor text, and anime-style art. Each copy of Whack a Catgirl also comes with a 2-card mini expansion for Gold Thief (2 copies of the new Pirate card).
31216.name: Whack a Catgirl

31217.name: Whooops!
31217.description:
Each player controls a taxi & a pram. The taxis travel across the board for 10 shilling fares. The prams are used to block the progress of rival taxis.

Contents

1 x Playing board
4 x Taxis
4 x Prams
8 x Plastic bases
50 x 10 shilling notes
1 x Die
1 x Rules leaflet

31218.name: Monopolist
31218.description:
From the publisher:
On this board the great struggle between capital and labor can be fought out to the satisfaction of all parties, and, if the players are successful, they can beat the Monopolists and become Monopolists themselves.

Players compete to form monopolies while avoiding embarrassment, loss of credit, unlucky ventures, and impaired capital.

31219.name: Kamp Killjoy
31219.description:
Kamp Killjoy is the second game in the Psychos and Slashers series of card games, designed to recreate the silliest aspects of 'B' horror films. You become a psychotic killer stalking innocent victims, competing with other mad slashers to acquire the choicest morsels . . . This second game in the series is designed to be played either on its own, or in combination with the earlier game, Suburban Slasher.

The two games were also sold together as the Psychos and Slashers Deluxe Set.

Related to / Can be combined with:

Suburban Slasher

31220.name: Target for Today
31220.description:
From the Manufacturer:

It’s 1943, and the only way for the Allies to carry the war to the Germans is from the air. But strategic bombing is an experiment; can they succeed where no one else has, or will the Luftwaffe’s air defenses cause the USAAF to fail, as every other bombing campaign to date has?

This decision-rich, tense Print N’ Play game puts you in charge of either the US bombing campaign or the aerial defense of the Reich. Not only do you have to select and achieve your military objectives; you also must maintain enough support for your campaign to keep resources flowing to you. Will you support ground offensives? Build currently available aircraft or invest in technology? Order your fighters to stick close to the bombers or sweep the sky for interceptors? Attack immediately with what’s in the air, or combine your fighter groups? Defend each target as it’s attacked or wait and launch a huge strike against one raid? The decisions are all yours.

31221.name: Bulls and Bears: The Great Wall St. Game
31221.description: Players make bets on whether stocks and commodities will rise or fall. Each turn a spinner determines the results, so it's a game that is almost 100% luck.

31223.name: Scooby-doo! Monster Mystery Game
31223.description:
Produced for McDonald's Corp. for give-a-way in Happy Meals.

I comes with a board, playing pieces and a unique die roller.

Each player takes turns moving across the board. There are 10 'monster discs' (out of 12) on spaces on the board. Each of these has a hidden message that you must 'decode' by looking at it through the red moon. Once you've landed on it you must follow the instructions on it.

The object is to collect as many of these as possible. They also contain a hidden amount of points. First one to the end also earns bonus points.

The game ends when all plays have reached the end.

31224.name: Kongman
31224.description:
Box text:
It's a game of high skill and daring. The perilous path to Kongman's kingdom isn't easy. The "No-Go" bridge, the magnetic crane, the captive balloon and the incredible magic wall have to be conquered. Have you got what it takes to reach the top?

A dexterity game similar to Screwball Scramble, but battery operated and vertical (a timer will stop the game, all obstacles are numbered with score points, the player reaching the highest score with the metal ball within the given time wins).

31225.name: Discover Iowa
31225.description:
From the box (rules printed on bottom of box lid)

"Object of the game-To be the first player to tour the state of Iowa and cross the finish line. He therefore is named the winner."

This is a simple roll and move game featuring a map of the state of Iowa. There are two decks of 16 cards with basic information on Iowa which must be played when pawns land on various spaces.

The game was published by Hesse Limited, of Sioux City Iowa in 1979. Hesse Limited was owned by Hessco Limited.

31226.name: Lazo
31226.description: Lazo is an abstract tile placing game. The object is to form a loop, either on the board surface or 3-dimensionally. The tiles stack like cannonballs. The board is a grid of triangular holes, in the overall shape of a trapezoid.

31227.name: Fields of Battle: Primitive Combat
31227.description:
The first installment in the Fields of Battle series. A print-and-play board game for 2 or more players. Playable with community deck or customized individual decks. FREE DOWNLOAD

The core Fields of Battle board/card game is a combat tactics and strategy game set in a pre gun powder era. You and your opponent(s) each have an HQ and a small army (multiple d6). Double-effect cards allow you to add more troops or cause something interesting to happen. Upgrade your troops, move across varying terrain, take advantage of your surroundings and destroy an enemy HQ. Simple. Satisfying.

http://www.feltd.com/games/

31228.description:
On March 7th, 1945, the Americans captured one of the last standing across the mighty Rhine River in Germany. It was pure luck that the Germans had failed to blow the bridge up.

Operation Loralie, the codeword to destroy this key crossing and been fumbled. Fumbled badly by the Germans. Confusion reigned on the German side and the Americans seized the bridge.

Now, the battle began. Germany’s “wonder weapons” were all directed at the bridge, from V-2 Rockets (which came close), jet bombers, massive Jagdtiger, Jagdpanther, Tiger II tanks and even SS Frogmen, all took their turn at sending the bridge to the bottom of the Rhine. The 9th, 11th and Lehr Panzer Divisions attempted to destroy the American bridgehead but were low of fuel.

The game captures this pure luck situation, as at any moment, luck can change the course of the battle, as in real life! All the elements are present that were there in the battle. What might have happened had the bridge been destroyed after the Americans had crossed? or, had the German panzers been able to attack as a coherent force?

The game uses a point to point movement system, easy to learn and hard to master. Daily turns, units range from company to battalions. The Americans must capture the bridge and cross to expand the bridgehead.
31228.name: Remagen 1945

31229.description:
Pacific 1942 Admiral is the cornerstone of the Pacific 1942 naval game as it is the basic version of the game consisting of high-quality wooden battle units and original hexagonal sextets used in all Pacific 1942 games. No miniatures!

This board game will move you into the area of Pacific battles during World War II. You will be suprised by variability of this game in which you can sail the battleships with cannons,command aircraft carriers with aircraft and troopships to transport your infantry. And you will have a tough objective - conquer four Pacific islands.
Pacific 1942 Admiral was "refurbished, rewritten and reloaded" in 2011.
31229.name: Pacific 1942 Admiral

31230.description:
Replay the battle that took place in 1830 around Brussels between the Netherlands and Belgian freedom fighters.

The Dutch fight to keep control over the city of Brussels, while the Belgians try to conquer the city. (with 3 and 4 players, the armies of both sides are split up in 2)
31230.name: 1830: Révolution Belge

31231.name: Psalms
31231.description: This is a religious themed game that challenges players to match scripture text from the Bible to their corresponding verse references or verse topics. Players track their matches on bingo-like scorecards and compete to see who can mostly quickly make rows of matches.

31232.name: The Amazing Adventures of Doctor Dolittle 3D Game
31232.description: This is a spin and move game for children themed on the classic Doctor Dolittle movie starring Rex Harrison. Players compete to be the first to navigate the board and accomplish certain objectives, including getting on and off Star Island and finding the Giant Pink Sea Snail. The gameboard. Players move by calling out an animal's name, spinning the spinner, and then reading how far the animal "said" to move. Players also can accumulate "adventure" cards which can help them with movement on the board.

31233.name: Shabbos is Coming!
31233.description: This is a children's game published in Hebrew and English which has a religious theme focusing on preparation for Shabbos or Shabbat, which in Judaism is the Sabbath day (day of rest). The game is similar to a chutes and ladders style game, with players moving up ladders and down slides to move from the bottom to the top of the board. The board uses religious imagery to connect this journey to appropriate preparation for the Sabbath.

31234.name: Milky Way
31234.description: You win the game by making it to planet Earth-- where your Milky Way Child will renew his or her Milky Way power and assist the Parentals in defeating the Evil Agents of the four supreme Galaxies. (Quoted from Instructions.)

31235.name: The Witcher
31235.description:
The game created for promotional purposes, available only with The Witcher PC RPG computer game.

The game consist of one 55 cards deck, and concentrates on competition between two players. During the gameplay players will wander across the world of The Witcher and fight numerous beasts. The game features adventure and strategic elements, combining a typical computer-game character development with a tactical approach known from board games. This card game's rules have been designed under the supervision of CD Projekt RED, the creators of the computer version of the game.

31236.name: Roosevelt at San Juan
31236.description: Children's trivia game designed to teach the facts of the Spanish-American war and Teddy Roosevelt's thoughts on it. Sample questions: Where did the Rough Riders land in Cuba? What should New York thank Roosevelt for?

31237.name: Game of the Little Volunteer
31237.description: Children's game in which players start as a little drummer boy and rise to the rank of Commander-in-Chief. Grisly images of bloodshed, apparently not troubling to parents of the times cover the gameboard.

31239.name: Boxer Rebellion
31239.description: Wargame depicting the Boxer Rebellion. Unusual Setting and Rules. Players are various foreign armies racing each other to the Legation neighborhood in the middle of Hong Kong. Players fight Chinese Army and Rebel Forces on the way there, who are only revealed by scouting. Counters and Map are provided.

31240.name: Game of Napoleon: The Little Corporal
31240.description: Players move around a board which teaches the life story of Napoleon, starting with his birth in Corsica through his exile on St. Helena. I suppose the goal is to NOT finish first.

31241.name: Game of War at Sea or "Don't Give Up the Ship"
31241.description:
Published at the time of the Spanish-American War, players move their ships across a checkerboard pattern covering the Gulf of Mexico, Carribean, the coast of Central America, and the U.S. Atlantic seaboard. The goal is to sweep the opponent's navy from the sea.

Game comes with 12 Battleships and 12 Torpedo Boats.

31243.name: The Game of Telegraph Boy or Merit Rewarded
31243.description: Similar to other McLoughlin Bros. games of this period, players start out in a menial job, then work their way up through hard work and virtue, and become President at game end.

31244.name: Colonial Empires
31244.description: Card game simulation of European Colonization and expansion circa 1600-1850. 10 different Nations to Choose from, each with its own special ability. 10 Colonial Regions to discover and exploit. Develop Home Industries. Wage war at home and in foreign lands. Amass the largest Fortune to win. Simple card play.

31245.name: I Love Chautauqua
31245.description: This is a Monopoly-style game using the theme of Jamestown, New York (USA) and the surrounding Chautauqua County. The various properties and spaces on the board reflect businesses, landmarks, and locations in Jamestown and Chautauqua County. This game also incorporates the history of the area, as the event cards in the game contain various historical anecdotes.

31246.name: Edmontonopoly
31246.description:
From the box:

It's EdmontonOpoly... the most exciting board game of the year! Budding tycoons can now buy and sell the most established business, landmarks, tourist attractions and restaurants in Edmonton with a simple roll of the dice in this fun filled - exciting new board game!

31247.name: Pimp City
31247.description:
Pimp City is the party game where you’re the pimp and your objective is to move your whore around the board, make the most money, and become the New Pimp Daddy!

Pimp City has Cat Fights, Trick Ownership, Truth or Dare options, Neighborhood Watch Cards, Slammer Time, Sugar Daddies, Big Tippers, The Alley, and even Revenge!

Home Page: http://www.pimpcitythegame.com/

31248.name: The Howard Hughes Game
31248.description:
In The Howard Hughes Game players move via die roll on a two-dimensional grid, drawing or trading cards when they land on the appropriate spaces. The goal is to get cards of the different types (Luck, Inheritance, and Corporate Know-How) for each of the eight phases of Hughes' life (as defined by the game) in turn. The phases are entered via "doors" on the board and the cards are turned in for money, which is tracked on a small board for each player. In true Hughes style, players may purchase injunctions to prevent movement through certain areas of the board. The object is to amass $2.5 billion dollars, the publisher's estimate of Hughes' fortune at the time.

In addition to the rules, the "Study Guide" booklet contains 21 pages of material on the life and investments of Howard Hughes and an extensive bibliography.

Although the name "Urban Systems" does not appear on the game, this is presumably the game in the case Rosemont Enterprises, Inc. v. Urban Systems, Inc. (72 Misc.2d 788, 789-90, 340 N.Y.S.2d 144, 145-46 [Sup.Ct.], modified, 42
App.Div.2d 544, 345 N.Y.S.2d 17 [App.Div.1973]). This case resulted in a judgement for Hughes against the game publisher, requiring them to withdraw the game from sale.

31249.description:
World of WarCraft: the Board Game Epic Armor Sets Mini-Expansion! Special custom sets of armor for each of the nine classes, straight out of World of Warcraft: The Boardgame! Oh, and a Murloc Suit, because who doesn't want a Murloc Suit?

Expands:

World of Warcraft: The Boardgame
31249.name: World of Warcraft: The Boardgame – BlizzCon Epic Armor Pack

31250.name: "Swish" Basketball Game
31250.description: Comes with a spinner, and a punch out basketball. The board is 13 1/2 by 10 1/2 inches and depicts basketball players from a red jerseyed team and a blue jerseyed team. Instructions are on the back of the board. Family sports game published sometime in the 1950s by Whitman.

31251.description:
The British Navy at bay - part two

Clash of Arms Games continues to explore warfare in the age of the fighting sail with Monsoon Seas. Monsoon Seas is Volume III of Mark Campbell's naval warfare Close Action series.

This set of special rules and scenarios covers mainly the 1777-1783 campaigns of French Admiral Pierre-Andre de Suffren and his battles with the Royal Navy in the South Atlantic and Indian Ocean (seventeen scenarios). The first three scenarios concern the Spanish-Portuguese War of 1776-1777 over what would become Uruguay.

20+ Scenarios explore the dramatic engagements and set piece battles of: Sadras, Providien, Negapatam, Trincomalee, Cuddalore and more.

This set of specific rules (72 pages), scenarios and historical commentary is a worthy successor to her highly acclaimed sister games Close Action and Rebel Seas.

(source: Clash fo Arms website and user's description))
31251.name: Monsoon Seas

31252.description: 80 Page Triumph of Chaos Comrades' Guide including 88 additional counters (armies, leaders, variants, etc), variants, strategy articles, play tips, historic analysis (American Foreign Legion, Kosciuszko Air Squadron, Ukrainian Galician Army and the insurgent army of anarchist Nestor Makhno), designer comments, survey of Russian Civil War games, many playaids and much more.
31252.name: Triumph of Chaos Comrades Guide

31253.name: Triple Crown
31253.description:
Each player uses pieces of a different colour.

On each of his turns a player rolls four dice. The value of one of the dice is taken as the ROW NUMBER. Two other dice together are the COLUMN number. The left over die is the scoring die. The cross section between ROW and COLUMN must be vacant to set the scoring die. Now if there are more Tiles adjacent to the new one (regardless of the colour) the you score. If there are tiles of your colour you´ll get some bonuses.

The game ends, when all players can not place one legal legal tile anymore. Player with highest score wins

31255.name: Knaves

boardgamecompilation.18272: Play Winning Card Games For Three

31255.description:
Each player tries to win tricks without taking any jacks.

This uses a standard deck of 52 cards. In each suit, the cards rank: A (high), K, Q, J, 10, 9, 8, 7, 6, 5, 4, 3, 2. The entire deck is dealt, except for the last card, which is revealed to determine the trump suit.

The player on the dealer's left has the first lead. Each player must then follow the suit of the led card if he can; if a player does not have a card of the suit led, he may play any card he wishes. The trick is won by the highest trump card played, or by the highest card of the suit led if no trumps are present. The winner of the trick leads the next trick.

At the end of each hand, each player scores one point for each trick taken, minus points for jacks:

hearts = -1 point
diamonds = -2 points
spades = -3 points
clubs = -4 point

(Mnemonic: if you have to take a Jack, you would love to take the one which hurts the least. Getting hit with a club hurts the most; getting hit with a spade hurts too, but not as much.)

A player may have a negative score. The winner is the first player to reach 20 points.

31256.name: Big Brother Truth or Dare
31256.description:
Big Brother Truth or Dare is an adult boardgame where players take turns answering opponents truth or dare cards.

The Truth or Dare cards contain more than 1,500 questions and each question has a corresponding level of naughtiness of either Prude, Rude or Lewd. Players progress around the board by moving the number of spaces indicated on each card - 1 for Prude, 2 for Rude and 3 for Lewd.

The winner is the first person to cross the finish line.

Dares range from "Play air guitar" through to "Snog another player", whilst questions include "When was the last time you were blindfolded?" and "Describe a love triangle you’ve been involved in."

31257.name: Nochnoj Dozor
31257.description:
This Russian card game is based on the novel and the film (2004) with the same name, also known as Night Watch.

The series is continued with Dnevnoj Dozor (Day Watch) with another mechanics.

31258.description:
Deep in their secret Siberian bases, the Russian Scientific Security Committee has assembled a weapon defying all known physical laws, Project Code Name: S.V.A.R.O.G.
During the project’s final testing phase, the laboratory super-generator suddenly exploded. Was it an overload? A commando attack? The awakening of ancient Slavic deities?

You can be a part of this exciting adventure in the upcoming Tannhäuser supplement Operation Novgorod.

Incarnate the role of Zor’Ka...
Discover the Religious Commissar Irena Kravchenko...
Stalk the ruins of an Ultra Top Secret Russian research center...
Master the talents of Major Volkov, a Hero decorated by the people with the prestigious Gold Star...

Collect new Equipment, Packs, and Objectives for the Union and the Reich. Challenge your opponents with new Game Modes and surprising rule variants. Get your fill of action, heroics, strategy, and suspense.

Find all this and more in Operation Novgorod!
31258.name: Tannhäuser: Operation Novgorod

31259.description:
Wolfgang Otto Ludwig Friedrich, alias Wolf, is a mercenary with no loyalty, no scruples, and no mercy. Willing to work for either the Reich or the Union if the price is right, Wolf is a consummate professional and a valuable asset to either side. The Wolf single miniature pack comes with everything you need to include Wolf in your Tannhäuser game: one pre-painted Wolf figurine, character sheet, game tokens, and a rulebook including a special bonus scenario featuring Wolf.

Wolf was originally a special promotional single miniature pack that was made available to all customers who preordered Tannhäuser either directly from Fantasy Flight's GenCon2007 booth or from the official FFG online store or participating brick-and-mortar retailers before August 25th, '07.
31259.name: Tannhäuser: Wolf

31260.description:
Description from BoardgameNews

In Agricola, you're a farmer in a wooden shack with your spouse and little else. On a turn, you get to take only two actions, one for you and one for the spouse, from all the possibilities you'll find on a farm: collecting clay, wood, or stone; building fences; and so on. You might think about having kids in order to get more work accomplished, but first you need to expand your house. And what are you going to feed all the little rugrats?

The game supports many levels of complexity, mainly through the use (or non-use) of two of its main types of cards, Minor Improvements and Occupations. In the beginner's version (called the Family Variant in the U.S. release), these cards are not used at all. For advanced play, the U.S. release includes three levels of both types of cards; Basic (E-deck), Interactive (I-deck), and Complex (K-deck), and the rulebook encourages players to experiment with the various decks and mixtures thereof. Aftermarket decks such as the Z-Deck and the L-Deck also exist.

Agricola is a turn-based game. There are 14 game rounds occurring in 6 stages, with a Harvest at the end of each stage (after Rounds 4, 7, 9, 11, 13, and 14).
Each player starts with two playing tokens (farmer and spouse) and thus can take two turns, or actions, per round. There are multiple options, and while the game progresses, you'll have more and more: first thing in a round, a new action card is flipped over.
Problem: Each action can be taken by only one player each round, so it's important to do some things with high preference.
Each player also starts with a hand of 7 Occupation cards (of more than 160 total) and 7 Minor Improvement cards (of more than 140 total) that he/she may use during the game if they fit in his/her strategy. Speaking of which, there are countless strategies, some depending on your card hand. Sometimes it's a good choice to stay on course, and sometimes it is better to react to your opponents' actions.
31260.name: Agricola

31261.name: Sexual Dilemmas
31261.description:
Sexual Dilemmas is not just a fun game to play. It also provides for stimulating conversation and frank discussion that may lead you to know everything you never wanted to know about your freinds, neighbors and relatives. Sample questions:

HIS: Your 15 year-old daughter asks if you have been sleeping with the woman you are dating. If so do you tell her?
HERS: Your neighbors have invited you to a hot tub party. Some of the people you know, some you don't. You are the only one who has brought a suit. Will you take off your clothes?

31262.description:
A clever little memory game where children drop brightly colored rods of varying lengths down hollow blocks of varying depths. The first player to line up three level heads in a row wins the game! When the rods are dropped, will they fall to the bottom of the block or stop somewhere in between? Switch the blocks and heads around each time you play to encourage memory development and essential silly skills!

Contents:
9 wooden blocks of various depths, 2 rod holders, 2 sets of 9 colored rods of various lengths, instructions.
31262.name: Silly Stix

31263.name: King for a Day
31263.description:
Players take the part of competing nobles trying to become king.

Players bid for special abilities, collect resource cards and gold and also build structures to generate gold and more power.

At the end, the player with the most Power wins.

Home Page: http://www.fairplaygames.com/newworldgames/bnw/3%204%205.htm...

31264.name: Bumpback
31264.description: In Bumpback your goal is to move all of your pawns from the start space around the board to the finish space before your opponent. The game can be played with anywhere from 2 to 8 pawns per player. If you wish to play a shorter game you may choose fewer pawns to start with. If you wish to play a longer game you can start with more pawns. Players take turns rolling and moving their pawns around the board. The game includes a Bumpback die that can be rolled when you land on a space that is occupied by another player. The Bumpback die sends pawns back to their start position. Each space has six dots on it and the number rolled on the Bumpback die applies to any pawn resting on that numbered dot. The game can get very exciting with 4 players and 32 pawns on the board.

31265.name: Royal Flush
31265.description: The "exciting action game of Poker Cubes". The game plays like Yahtzee, but instead of using normal dice you use cubes with card symbols on them. The top section of the score card has each card symbol on the dice, Ace, Nine, Ten, Jack, Queen, and King. Each is assigned a value 1 to 6. You score the number assigned times the number of dice you roll of that type. Just like Yahtzee you get a bonus if you score high enough in the top section. In the bottom section you attempt to get a straight, full house, royal flush, etc..

31266.name: Oneonta Whist
31266.description:
This is a cardgame, originally developed as a solitaire trick-taking game. It is derived from Spades and Whist.

Rules for cooperative play:
Go around, and everyone makes their bids. The object is for the group to collectively (every person in their group) to meet their bids. Players determine at the start how much communication is allowed between players. Everyone plays as one team. The object is to get a high score. One could also base scoring around lowest scoring player.

31268.name: Medievalia
31268.description:
Western Europe, middle of the VIII century. The players take on the role of the growing monastic orders of the time, and their mission is to be first in building a certain number of abbeys across the board. Round after round, the senior abbots of each order rely on the benefits derived from those in power to make their abbeys the most influential political, spiritual or production centers, or all three, as those hardy monks were at the same time those who prayed, those who fought and those who worked.

Game elements:

1 Board (Showing a map of Western Europe divided in 7 regions)
5 Senior Abbot figures
6 Power cards (King, Baron, Hermit, Abbot, Bishop and Townsman)
6 Brother cards (Herbolarius, Cook, Secretary, Blacksmith, Goldsmith, Copyist)
10 Action markers (2 in each of the players’ colors)
36 Power tokens (12 of each: Spiritual, Political, and Material)
36 Foundation markers (featuring two or three power symbols)
50 Abbeys (10 in each of the players’ colors)
84 Buildings (14 of each: Chancellery, Blacksmith shop, Scriptorium, Basilica, Wheat, Wine Cellar.)
102 Good tokens (17 of each: Books, Reliquaries; Letters, Shields; Wine Bottles, loaves of Bread)
50 coins (30 x $5, 20 x $1)
1 Pope figure

31269.name: TAASEN
31269.description:
TAASEN
The Game Of Tryslmaistan Chess

A web published game, described as an analogue of Chess (but feeling closer to Checkers in depth). Played on a triangular board made up of triangles. Each player has three pieces. A third set of three pieces (white) is available for use by either play.

On your turn you may move one of your pieces or a white piece.

The objective is to remove your opponent's pieces from the board or immobilize them. Unlike chess, your pieces push your opponent's (and White's) pieces around into free spaces. If no space is free, then the pushed piece is removed.

This game was developed after appearing in the web comic "Unicorn Jelly".

The game's home page : http://www.unicornjelly.com/taasen1.html

31270.name: Bratz Girl Talk
31270.description:
From the Manufacturer:

The Stylin' Game of Truth or Dare

Want to laugh with your friends? Express your passion for fashion? Do krazy things? Then dare to play BRATZ GIRL TALK.

Sing a song...strut your stuff...tell a tale...and lots more. That's what BRATZ GIRL TALK is all about!

Spin the spinner and see if you'll have to do a funadelic stunt or answer a "tell all" question. Not hip enough to complete the dare? Then you won't score the points for that turn! Be the first to get 25 points and you rule. Ten check out the BRATZ CHAT cards you've collected to see just what your friends really think of you!

Ages 8 and up.

31271.name: French Military Game
31271.description:
The French Military Game, sometimes called Hare & Hounds, is the smallest and most simple of all hunt games. It originated in 19th century France, and became popular with French military officers during the Franco-Prussian War of 1870-1871.

An article by Martin Gardner in the journal Scientific American generated further interest in the game in 1963, and it has become popular with computer programmers due to the ease of implementing its simple rules.

Other versions are played on a 8*8 chessboard with 4 hounds. 1 Contra 4 is a game released in 1976 which replaces the chessboard with an own created board, but there is no difference in gameplay.

From the Rodent Roundup version:

The chase is on! It's three crafty cats against one tricky mouse. Who will outsmart whom in this game of chase?

One player controls the three cats. That player's job is to trap the mouse so it can't make a move (cats win). The other player controls the mouse. The mouse must try to scurry past the cats and get free (mouse wins).

The cats may only move forward, sideways, and forward diagonally along the inscribed lines on the playing surface. Only one cat may move per turn. The mouse may move in any direction, including backwards, one move per turn.

31272.name: Pegleg Pete's Deck of Royal Rogues

boardgameversion.91270: Bent Castle Workshops Black Deck edition

31272.description: This is a standard deck of 52 playing cards plus 4 extra cards and 2 jokers. The extra cards are the Serpents of Clubs, diamonds, hearts, and spades. The deck can be used to play any game you can play with a standard poker deck. The entire deck has a pirate motif. All the art is new and original.

31273.name: Skulls
31273.description:
Quoted from the back of the package Copyright 1981 Flying Buffalo Inc.:

Skulls
A game for any number of people
Required: two "Death Dice", paper and pencil

This game is played in six rounds. The object is to get the highest score after six rounds. Each of the two dice has number on five of the six sides, and a skull on the sixth side.

Determine which player goes first by any convenient method. First player rolls both dice. If no skulls are showing, the player adds the numbers showing to his score for the round. He he has the option of rolling again, or passing the dice to the next player. If he passes the dice, his turn is over, and the score he has rolled so far is "protected." If he rolls again, he may get more points, but he may also lose all the points he has received so far that round. A player may continue to roll the dice until he decides to pass them, or until he rolls one or more skulls. If a player rolls one skull, he loses all the points he has gained that round, and gets a score of zero for the round. He must then pass the dice to the next player. If a player rolls two skulls, he loses all the points he as gained that round, and in all previous rounds. He is completely wiped out, and must start again the next round. He must pass the dice to the next player.

After all the players have had a chance to roll the dice, draw a line under the scores to signify that the scores above the line are "protected" (i.e., cannot by wiped out the the roll of a single skull). Note that each player must roll the dice at least once each round.

Subsequent rounds: In the following rounds, players roll the dice in the order of their score so far. The player with the highest score at they end of the first round will roll first for the second round. The player with the second highest score will roll second, and so on. There is an advantage to rolling last, so we give that position to the player who is losing the worst. If two players are tied for score, they may roll a dice or flip a coin to determine which must roll first.

At the end of six rounds the player with the highest score wins. If two players are tied for the highest score, then all players must roll another round.

Hint: although the odds of rolling a skull on any one roll are always exactly the same as any other roll, the more times you roll in one round, the more points you are rising on any one roll.

Flying Buffalo Inc. P.O. Box 1467 Scottsdale, AZ 85252
Product Number 0204
1981

31274.name: Zacrobates
31274.description:
Like classic Memory, the game begins with 48 tiles face down in the center. Unlike Memory however, each tile is unique and instead of trying to match pairs, the players are trying to build a set of 10 tiles, which each new tile collected being of higher rank than the previous one.

The game is simple enough for children to play, but strategic enough for adults to enjoy.

31275.name: Home Base Ball Game
31275.description: Simple children's baseball game from the turn of the last century. Mechanical bat swings at a small pitched ball with 7 tin fielders which may "field" the ball.

31276.name: Game of Golf
31276.description: A simple children's roll and move game in which the goal is to complete six holes of golf. Good rolls make the ball land in the fairway and make for a quick game. Poor rolls send the player into the rough, making the path to each hole longer.

31277.name: Excursion to Coney Island
31277.description: Similar to the Peter Coddle games, players read about an trip to Coney Island filled with adventure, with players inserting funny phrases either at random or after they've been dealt and players shout them out when appropriate, or perhaps it's funnier when the words are inappropriate.

31278.name: Game of City Life or the Boys of New York
31278.description: Very simple game in which players draw cards and play into or take from a community pool. The real point of the cards is to show the various types of people living in NYC, which was then as it is now, the largest and grandest city in the Union. Cards vary from the positive to the very negative.

31279.name: Game of Race Around the World
