31420.description: The first expansion to Cutthroat Caverns, Deeper & Darker adds fifteen new monsters to hinder your quest to escape alive with the Sacred Item of Unimaginable Marvel...which means fifteen new monsters to use against your "friends" that are trying to escape with your artifact. It also adds some impact to character choice--each now has a unique ability, usable once per game, that might give you that special push that you need to make sure that you're the one left standing with the most Prestige when the dust settles.
31420.name: Cutthroat Caverns: Deeper & Darker

31421.name: Skräll
31421.description: Set in space far in the future, players attempt to conquer the universe before the other players can do it first. A variable board setup ensures a different game every time; after that, turns are fast-paced and simple. Planets can be attacked or negotiated with; effects are determined with a D6. Released at GenCon as a small publishing effort.

31422.name: Bizerte Gertie
31422.description:
from CELEBRATING BOARD GAMES by Nina Chertoff and Susan Kahn.

This is a game that could only come from a different era.

Bertie Gertie is a game for 4 players, all servicemen on leave during World War II. Their goal is to take a walk with a beautiful woman on the beach. The object of the game is not to be the player left with the "ugly" one. The token game piece for that "ugly" girl was a "dog".

comment: Can you ever imagine that a huge Game Manufacturer like Milton Bradley would ever produce a game like this today!

31423.name: Tank Battles in Miniature 3
31423.description:
subtitle - A wargamer's guide to the North-West European Campaign 1944-1945

Book including miniatures rules for wargames in France/Lowcountries/Germany during WW2.

From the publisher's description;

"...includes eye-witness descriptions of armoured warfare in 1944-45; a brief chronology of the whole campaign, well illustrated by numerous maps; technical data in the tanks, armoured car, self-propelled guns and other weapons and vehicles used by both sides; and detailed descriptions of Allied and German army organisation at the time.
There are sections too on amphibious assault, naval gunfire support on the invasion beaches, parachute and glider landings, tank and anti-tank gun data and ground attack and anti-aircraft fire"

31425.name: Search & Rescue
31425.description:
Four areas in the Park are reserved for exploration: a lake with an island, desert conditions, mountainous trails and forest paths.

Stormy weather comes up and a child, a young woman, an older man and a family of five are missing. We are a search & rescue team sent out to find and rescue these missing persons.

We share equipment, develop strategies and contend with mounting storm centers! Tense, real life situations are faced. On each turn, tough choices have to be made. Only working as a team can lead to a happy ending.

Contents:
12x12-inch board showing four park areas
cards depicting motor power
horn hailer
infrared binoculars
trained search dog
GPS tracker
storm passes
rescue equipment: jeep, helicopter, boat & searchers
4 people tokens
28 storm tokens
rules

31426.description: The Scrabble Junior Madeline edition features the adventurous little girl Madeline. She and her friends (Miss Clavel, Pepito and the eleven other girls) are out for a walk in the park. The board features pictures and the corresponding words for the people and things they encounter. Players earn one of Madeline's little yellow hats when they match their letters to the already spelled out words on the board. The board is two-sided, one side for French and the other English. Included with the game are 18 bilingual flash cards to teach French and English.
31426.name: Scrabble Junior Madeline

31428.name: All Stars Coach
31428.description: In All Stars Coach, players form their own soccer teams (based on real players; cards represent the players of a team). Different players have different prices, abilities and so on. After the card drafting phase the actual game begins where the actual soccer match is played on the game board.

31429.name: Mr. Frog
31429.description: Mr. Frog is a children's game where player put leaves on a fungus with a frog on it. As more leaves are put on the fungus it becomes shaky and finally falls over, dropping the frog. The winner is the player who first loses all his/her leaves without dropping the frog.

31432.name: The Great War
31432.description:
The Great War is a World War I themed game along the lines of Axis and Allies. It introduces many new units, such as blimps, railway guns, cruiser and armored cars. As well as, aspects particular to the Great War, such as poison gas, trench warfare, convoys and railways. Additionally, neutral powers are subject to political influencing in order to draw them into one or other alliance.
The game is primarily available as a MapView module, but can also be played as a table top game.

31434.name: Multiplex
31434.description: German card game designed to assist children in learning multiplication tables along with shape and color recognition. Ages 7 and up

31435.description:
Infernal Contraption 2: Sabotage! is an expansion the the Infernal Contraption base game. It adds 48 new cards which include 3 new upgrades, 12 new power sources, 15 new consumables, and most importantly 18 sabotage cards!

What are sabotage cards? From the publisher:
A Sabotage card brings a new twist to the game. They allow you to throw the proverbial monkey wrench into your opponent's machine - making it malfunction is disastrous ways and all to your advantage. Put a stop to your opponent's pesky card-stealing contraptions, or power down his upgrades with sabotage cards like the Exothermic Reactor, Power Spike, or the Gremlin Sphere. You can really unleash some mayhem with these cards - and really ratchet up your own fun!

Expands:

Infernal Contraption
31435.name: Infernal Contraption 2: Sabotage!

31436.name: Police Patrol
31436.description: Police Patrol by Hasbro is a simple spin and move game where the object of the game is to watch out for unlawful or dangerous incidents that occur on your watch. You score points by dealing with things like Lost Children, Accidents, Traffic Violations and Robberies. Game comes with a plastic police car, 5 policemen, a cardboard town complete with police station and 3 spinners which determine what happens during the game.

31437.name: MasterMinds and Monkey-Shines
31437.description:
"Designed for Adults, Enjoyed by Children"

Three ways to play:

Game I - The Master Bluff (Ultimate Party or Parlor Game)

First player to reach 50 points wins. Bluffmaster selects 3 cards, chooses one. Reads the question aloud and answer aloud (from provided answers or makes one up). One answer on the card is correct. Opponents score points by correctly agreeing or disagreeing.

Game II - Black Jack (Twenty-one Points Makes You a Winner)
Roll a die to determine number of points scored or lost in a turn. Answer trivia questions. First to 21 wins.

Game III - Strike-Out (Groups and Groups of Fun)
For two large groups of players. Each team lines up and face off (Family Feud style). Players are eliminated with 3 incorrect answers. Last one standing wins.

Equipment is a generous collection of question cards with multiple choice answers, an answer key, several agree and several disagree cards, die.

31438.name: Aliens
31438.description:
Aliens are here!

Everybody has seen them but not you. You have to find who are the liars and who tell the true.

Card game where the players play the role of the "lie detector".
They will try to guess if affirmations made by the other players are wrong when playing as “lie detector” or they will try to mislead the lie detector when making affirmations.

31439.name: Шпионы
31439.description:
In the decade of the 30s during the 20th century, with the hope of peace already lost, European powers try get organized before the war begins by improving their trust in their secret service organizations.

In this game, German Abwher, British SIS, Soviet NKVD and the French Surete compete to establish agent networks, adding new members in order to steal military secrets.

This game contains:
-A map of Europe from the 1930's
-24 "spies" counters with numbers 1 to 6
- 32 "Top secret" counters
- 60 game cards
-4 dice

31442.description:
Subtitled: A Convention Tournament Game. This reworking of the Avalon Hill classic Le Mans, is staged only at conventions, including Gen Con, and special weekend events. The track is over 12' long and 6' wide. Players wear numbered vests that match their cars and the cars are moved around the track as players choose their gear, speed, whether or not to risk corners, and manage their tires. To a certain extent, players are also able to manage their cars' condition as they choose whether to drive conservatively, competitively, or press. Pressing will increase a car's speed, while also increasing the chance of mechanical problems cropping up in the car.

Games last 5 - 24 hours, that's no joke, players schedule 24 hour games. In "short" five-hour games, players race independently. In 8-hour games, players drive in 2-man teams, and while "driving" players are not afforded food, drink, or bathroom breaks! In the 24-hour version of the game, cars are driven by 2 or 3-man teams with players driving longer shifts, which allows time for sleeping.
31442.name: Eight Hours of Le Mans

boardgamehonor.21290: 2007 Charles S. Roberts Best Pre-World War II Boardgame Nominee

31443.description:
THE HABIT OF VICTORY
From Warsaw and Eylau to Friedland: 6 December 1806 - 29 June 1807

GAME DESCRIPTION

Campaigns of Napoleon System, Series 2X. Game Mechanics are the same as Napoleon at the Crossroads, with the addition of the cards.





Card Assisted Game (CAG) plays with far fewer dice rolls, and quicker overall.



Each card represents a Movement Command specifying attrition, administration, etc., and allows for one-time events such as: political, military, officer feuds, and guerrilla war. Because they define Movement more closely, the cards make attrition a matter of a quick read-off at a glance.



Three short introductory scenarios simulate the battles of Pultusk/Golymin, Eylau, and Friedland.



Three full-sized campaign scenarios depict the three phases of the war-the Crossing of the Bug and Battles of Pultusk and Golymin, the campaign and battle of Eylau in February, and the final miscalculation by Bennigsen at Friedland.



A massive Grand Scenario of up to 69 turns.



During major battles entire armies can be concentrated under just a few leaders. At other times units can be dispersed independently along with Cavalry Vedettes which help confuse the enemy.


COMPONENTS

One 22 x 34" map in four colors
280 two-sided leaders, units and markers
100 playing cards that represent March Orders the players can issue
56 pages of rules including campaign analysis, designers notes and more
French, Russian and Prussian Organization Displays
Turn Record, Coalition and French Record Tracks




GAME SYSTEM CNS 2x
- scale = 6 km (3.75 mi)/hex,
- time = 3 days/GT,
- strength = 3,000 men/SP.
31443.name: The Habit of Victory

31444.name: V-game
31444.description:
This is an anti-Nazi game from the 1940's which was produced by underground opposition forces in Belgium during the Second World War.

Players use a crude spring to launch wooden pieces onto a board with four sections of different point values. The two outer rings included the names of German cities. The third ring had cartoon images of top Nazi officials such as propaganda minister Joseph Goebbel. The inner ring - with the highest score of 100 points - showed Adolf Hitler.

The box for the game shows a picture of Hitler riding atop a German V-1 rocket and wearing a British royal crown.
(excerpts from CBC news coverage)

31445.name: Navigator
31445.description: A game of sail racing, players race around buoys while avoiding obstacles. This is a very early game of hand management, as players pull and play cards from their hand of four trying to set up successful runs around the board. Also of historical note, the game includes rules for a solitaire game and two alternative sets of rules using the same components.

31446.name: Duel of Eagles
31446.description:
Duel of Eagles is a set of miniatures rules designed for 1/300th scale miniature aircraft. It covers 1939-1945, and has plane statistics for a variety of aircraft in the WW2 time frame.

The movement system is hexless, and allows the player to tighten turns by utilizing changes in altitude.

Basic campaign rules are included.

31447.name: Shark Attack! Bowling
31447.description: This is a simple bowling game in which players take turns winding up a motorized shark and aiming it at six fish-shaped pins placed 2.5 to 3 meters away (8-10 ft) on a hard floor. The motor is built such that the shark starts by moving slowly, but then quickly lunges forward. A steering dial on the shark allows for hooks.

31449.description:
Description from BoardgameNews.com:

Army of Frogs is for 2-4 players and resembles Hive in that the gameboard is created while you play. The goal of the game is to create one large group of frogs—an army, if you will—through tactical manoeuvring and placement of the pieces, which are hexagonal Bakelite frogs. Each player starts with two randomly drawn frogs, and on a turn a player takes the following three actions to build and shift an island of frogs in the center of the table:

if possible, move a frog of his color that’s on the board to a new location (something that’s obviously skipped on the first turn)
add one of the frogs in his supply to the board, and
draw a new frog from the bag and add it to his supply.




The first player to link all their frogs (with at least seven in play) wins the game.
31449.name: Army of Frogs

31450.name: Jeu des Petites annonces de France-Soir
31450.description:
Literally "Play of the small advertisements of France-evening"


Description from A Gamut of Games

Sid Sackson mentions this game on p12 of A Gamut of Games. He writes that it "… has a delightful gallic flavor. Players move around a board showing a map of Paris. They acquire children by landing on the proper spaces. The children are educated by landing on other spaces, after which they are sent out to work. The winner is the first player who is able, by using the earnings of his children, to buy a bank."

31451.name: What's That?
31451.description: A "parlour game" in which points are scored by being able to identify everyday objects from photographs of them taken from unusual angles or close-up. Each guest gets a photograph and, during the course of the evening, when socialising, they can ask to see the other's photograph. They then write down what they think the answer should be. When their record sheet is full, they give it to the host. The one with the most correct answers wins.

31453.description:
Holy Roman Empire: Wars of the Reformation, 1524-38 (HRE) is a wargame of intermediate complexity intended for play by four, three or two.

The era it covers – from the Peasants Revolt to the Truce of Nice – was one that proved decisive in shaping what has since come to be known as ‘modernity.’ On one side was the Holy Roman Empire, the (theoretically) Europe-wide polity under control of the Hapsburgs. Contending against them were the Kingdom of France, the Ottoman Empire and miscellaneous minor states, as well as the rising tide of Protestantism.

HRE is primarily intended to be played by four, each representing a different major power: the Hapsburgs, France, the Ottomans, and the “League” (the latter representing assorted minor power coalitions that came and went). Each player has a variety of military and political instruments with which he can attempt to gain control of Europe. The rules are written with procedures for four-player games in mind; however, games with three or two players can also be managed by using the altered framework provided for such contests.
31453.name: Holy Roman Empire

boardgamehonor.12258: 2007 Spiel der Spiele Hit für Zwei Recommended

31454.description:
Stratego Fortress is a 3D variant of Stratego.
Each of the two players control a fortress with 3 levels and also some noble knights to invade the opposite fortress. Goal is to capture the adversarial flag.
There are secret passages to discover, pitfalls to avoid, deal with powerful wizards and sneaky dwarfs. Beware also of the the princess or you will succumb to her charm. Only the bravest will win.

Awards

2007 Spiele Hit für Zwei
31454.name: Stratego Fortress

31455.name: The War
31455.description:
In Война (War) each player take control of a German, division, allies division (deck). The card represent resources, battle groups, planes, artillery, heroes, tactical decisions, battle events…

There are different series "The Kharkov to El Alamein", "Stalingrad", "Victory Day"…

31456.name: Claymores
31456.description: Rules for combat using bladed weapons. All known blades are listed or will match one listed. This is single figure combat. Most players can handle 4 figures at one time. Great for tournaments.

31457.name: Skirmishers
31457.description:
From Publisher's site

Rules for single figure combat 1780 to 1880. Especially the ACW and Indian Wars. Various weapons are available to choose from. There are rules for a block army version. Fantasy figures for this period are available, especially or the Nappy wars. Army lists are included.

31458.description:
From publishers site.

Take command of one of the five actual subs during the ACW. Each has its own special way of sinking the target. This solo game is quick, fun and habit forming. The example is the record board for your sub. Warning do not order if you hate losing. The chance to win is the same as it was in real life: 25%.
Great game to introduce older kids to gaming.
31458.name: Brown Water Subs

31459.name: The Glorious Cause
31459.description: The Glorious Cause is an introductory game on the American Revolution on a strategic level. It has an area movement map, a one-page set of rules and low number of counters.

31460.name: Urbs & Civitas
31460.description: Urbs & Civitas introduces the fundamental concepts of street addressing in the urban context all the while demonstrating the importance of its derived benefits: revenue generation, crime reduction, increased commerce & tourism, improved public health & safety, and good governance. Integrating street addressing as the foundational tool in the urban management process, Urbs & Civitas then progresses by assigning much importance to continued infrastructure development. Game play emphasizes strong player interaction and management skills by balancing revenue generation versus maintenance costs and promotes the advantages of street addressing through ongoing civic improvement.

31461.name: Chrono Blocks
31461.description:
From the Mindware site:

Tick, Tock—Quick, Find a Place for That Block!

Put your spatial skills to the test! Fit the correct block on the structure and hit the stop button before time runs out—move too slowly, and the base vibrates, setting off an avalanche of brightly colored pieces. Words, music and lights add urgency and get kids excited to play game after game. Includes 24 blocks, electronic building base with three levels of difficulty, volume control and auto shut-off feature. Requires three AA batteries (not included).

Ages 6 and up

31462.description: Children's boardgame featuring the star of the Welsh cartoon classic, Ivor the Engine, created by Oliver Postgate. The first person to reach the engine shed wins. Some squares have access to Branch Lines that make you jump ahead or fall behind.
31462.name: Branch Lines

31463.description:
Children's boardgame featuring the stars of the Welsh cartoon classic, Ivor the Engine, created by Oliver Postgate. Pick up three flowers for the flower show and return home to win.

Players may travel around the board in any direction they choose except backward. Land on a flower square to pick up a flower, land on a rectangle to pick up a card, or land on a circle to pick up a penny. Pennies can either modify a roll of the dice or 3 may be used to buy a flower.

Scans of the colourful components featuring elements of Ivor's adventures are available at:
http://www.smallfilms.co.uk/ivor/games.htm
31463.name: The Flower Game

31466.name: Wargods of Olympus
31466.description: Similar to WarGods of Ægyptus, Wargods of Olympus is a fantasy miniatures battles game with a quasi-historical theme. This time the theme is ancient Greece with players building and painting their own miniature armies of Spartans, Titans, Wendigos or other denizens of Greek Mythology.

31467.name: Slimetrail
31467.description:
Slimetrail is a two-player, abstract game played on a rectangular grid (or a rhombus made of hexagons, as in Hex). Each player takes turns moving a piece around the board. The piece can be moved one space, and may not re-visit a visited cell. Two goal cells are located at diagonally opposite corners of the rectangle (or in the obtuse corners of the rhombus). You win if either player moves the piece into your goal cell.

The rules at Game Cabinet state that "the piece starts on any mutually agreed upon square". But since this is a finite game, with enough computing power it can be determined which player has the winning strategy depending on the initial placement, so in principle no cell would be mutually agreeable. In practice, the Pie Rule can be used.

31468.name: Herbs
31468.description:
Space aliens captured and cloned a janitor named Herb to play a new game...

Herbs is a fun and simple strategy game where players make their moves simultaneously. It's like a simulated arcade game, which makes players rely more on good thinking than quick reflexes. Success in the game will depend on carefully devising your plans while leaving plenty of room for the unexpected.

Object
Each player will control two Herbs attempting to simply score the most points using 200 Action Points. Points will be scored by eliminating stones or by forming certain scoring patterns with the stones. Destroying an opponent's Herb also scores points.

31469.name: The Two Pipers
31469.description:
extracted from the Game Cabinet listing for the rules for this game:

This is a strategy game with simple rules. The complexity of play could be compared to that of checkers.

The game requires a standard checker board and eighteen markers for the game. A set of markers for one player consists of a PIPER and eight creatures. You'll need two sets, one for each player, in different colors. The creatures' markers are two-sided. One side of the marker shows the creature asleep, and the other shows it attacking. Not surprisingly, these creatures are referred to as "SLEEPERS" and "ATTACKERS" depending on which side is up.

The Object
Be the first to move your PIPER across the swamp or to eliminate your opponent's PIPER.

Winning the Game
If a player manages to get his or her PIPER across the swamp to the land where the opponent started, that player wins the game.

A player also wins if he or she eliminates the PIPER belonging to the opponent.

For purposes of winning, it is assumed that both PIPERS could stand on one of the land squares at the same time. In other words, a player can't prevent a win by planting his PIPER on the land and refusing to move it!

31470.description:
Test your knowledge of Coronation Street as you journey to Roy's Rolls, Underworld, the Corner Shop and, of course, the Rovers Return, while watching clips and answering questions about one of television's most beloved soaps.

How much do you remember about Stan and Hilda or Jack and Vera? What about the love triangle between Ken, Deirdre and Mike or the one between Mike, Linda and Mike's son, Mark? How much do you really know about Roy and his transsexual wife Hayley, Tracy's mystery baby or the Weatherfield One? Find out as you compete for chips and trophies in this game that will prove just how "street smart" you really are.

This interactive DVD board game contains more than 700 questions across 6 different categories using clips, stills and story lines from this popular British soap opera. Question categories include : Families, Workplace, Romance, Rovers, Feuds and Friendship. Includes 12 Pub Quiz 'Beermats', featuring questions about the characters in the soap.
31470.name: Coronation St. DVD Game

31471.name: Procession
31471.description:
Procession is an abstract strategy game of trying to move a master piece (queen) across a chess board along routes projected horizontally and vertically from 5 setup pieces (pawns).

Full rules are at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=55

31472.name: Loom
31472.description:
An abstract game where the players place markers on a chess board in sequence, where they can only place makers that are horizontally or vertically in line with their existing marker(s) without interrupt by other markers, and not placed such that they are on any line between a pair of existing markers of the same color. Players are trying to form a box of their colour, or if they can't, have the longest lines of their color.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=57

31473.name: Royal-er Game of Ur
31473.description:
This is an abstract strategy game played with dice and a chess board. You are trying to move your dice across the chess board (in a fixed zig-zag pattern) before your opponent has move their dice across the board in the opposite pattern. The twist comes that after you have rolled and moved a die (which can be your own OR an opponents), it is placed on the board with the rolled number up, and if you land on a die, you move again based on the number showing, but forwards if it is your opponents die, but backwards if your own.

It has feeling of inspiration from a lot of traditional/classic board/chase games, including (obviously) Ur, but also Backgammon and Parcheesi.

Full rules at http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=53

31474.name: Statements
31474.description:
The Enron Game.

This game is a simulation of Enron and other corporate malfeasance type situations. Players can either roll dice to (honestly) make profits or state a profit level - but at the cost of "audit points" which increase the risk that an audit may reveal the malfeasance.

Full rules and description at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=36

31476.name: International Grand Prix Magnetic Road Race Game
31476.description:
"Completely self-contained... just remove cover and PLAY. Magnetic cars stick to special game board." - From front of box

Spin and move racing game with magnetic cars that stick to the track.

31477.name: Polarity
31477.description:
An abstract game played on a chess board with a common set of stones and few special pieces. The object is to get three or more stones in a row, using the combination of placing a stone (which can not be adjacent to any stone) and the using a power to push or pull stones -- either orthogonally or diagonally, or both -- but with the caveat that each power can only be used once until all powers have been used, then after an un-powered turn the powers are available again.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=32

The ¡Luchacabra! website is currently unavailable. Try looking for the rules at: www.luchacabra.com/?p=32' rel='nofollow'>http://web.archive.org/web/20080118033202/www.luchacabra.com... instead.

31478.name: Flying Swordsmen
31478.description:
An abstract game played on two chessboards and with stackable reversible counters. The boards are seen as flip-sides of each other (like sides of a coin), one player starts setup in the center of one side, the other in the center of the other side, with the goal being to have only your markers on the other player's side. Pieces can move farther and jump more adjacent pieces if they are stacked (up to 3 high). If pieces are jumped over they are either converted to the other color or eliminated, depending on how many pieces have been jumped over.

Full rules at: https://web.archive.org/web/20070504174755/http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=24

boardgamehonor.8766: 2008 Golden Geek Best Party Board Game Nominee

31479.description:
This is a sequel of successful Ubongo, but now on a higher level of difficulty. Just like in Ubongo, all players put their tiles simultaneously down on their player mat to fill up the requested shape as fast as possible. This isn't easy at all because of the new and uncommon shaped hexagonal tiles. It is as fascinating as the original, which proved to be addicting.

Re-implements:

Ubongo




Expanded by:

Ubongo Extrem Craxy Expansion




Microbadges:
31479.name: Ubongo Extreme

31480.name: Hobby Games: The 100 Best
31480.description: In Hobby Games: The 100 Best, the top designers, authors, and publishers in the hobby games field write about the most enjoyable and cleverly designed games of the last fifty years. Their essays cover the gamut of the hobby market, from board games to wargames, collectible card games to miniatures games to roleplaying games, with titles both familiar and esoteric. Writers include such legendary designers as Gary Gygax, Ian Livingstone and Steve Jackson, Richard Garfield, and Larry Harris; best-selling authors R. A. Salvatore, Tracy Hickman, Douglas Niles, and Ed Greenwood; computer industry notables Warren Spector, Bruce Shelley, Jack Emmert, and Bruce Nesmith; as well as dozens of other prominent and award-winning creators, including Richard Berg, Monte Cook, Zeb Cook, Greg Costikyan, Bruno Faidutti, Jeff Grubb, Steve Jackson (US), Tom Jolly, Marc W. Miller, Alan R. Moon, Christian T. Petersen, Sandy Petersen, Mike Pondsmith, Ted Raicer, Greg Stafford, S. Craig Taylor, Jr., Martin Wallace, James M. Ward, Jordan Weisman, Stewart Wieck, and Teeuwynn Woodruff. Hobby Games: The 100 Best also features a foreword by board game legend Reiner Knizia and an afterward by SPI founder and wargame legend James F. Dunnigan.

boardgamehonor.8769: 2008 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee

31481.description:
In a galaxy far, far away... they need sewer systems, too. Corporation Incorporated builds them. Everyone knows their drivers -- the brave men and women who fear no danger and would, if the pay was good enough, even fly through Hell.
Now you can join them. You will gain access to prefabricated spaceship components cleverly made from sewer pipes. Can you build a space ship durable enough to weather storms of meteors? Armed enough to defend against pirates? Big enough to carry a large crew and valuable cargo? Fast enough to get there first?

Of course you can. Become a Galaxy Trucker. It's loads of fun.

Galaxy Trucker is a tile laying game that plays out over two phases: building and flying. The goal is to have the most credits at the end of the game. You can earn credits by delivering goods, defeating pirates, building an efficient ship, and being the furthest along the track at the end of the flying phase.

Building happens in real time and has players build their personal space ships by grabbing tiles from the middle of the table before the timer runs out. Tiles start out facedown so they won't know what they have until they take it, but they may choose to return it faceup if they don't want it. They must place the tiles they keep in a legal manner in their space ship. Usually this just means lining up the connectors appropriately (single to single, double to double, universal to anything) but also includes proper positioning of guns and engines. Tiles represent a variety of things including guns, engines, storage containers, crew cabins, shields, and batteries. They may also peek at the cards they will encounter in phase 2, but they must sacrifice building time to do this. At any time players may call their ships finished and take an order marker from the center.

Once building is completed, and ships have been checked for errors, the flight begins. The flight cards are shuffled and player markers are placed on the flight board according to the order markers taken. Cards are revealed one at a time and players interact with them in order. They may include things such as pirates, abandoned vessels, disease outbreaks, meteor showers, worlds with goods to pick up, player-on-player combat zones, and other various things.

Most of the cards will cause players to move back on the flight track and they must decide if the delay is worth their efforts. When all the cards are encountered players sell any goods they have collected, collect their rewards for finishing in first, second, or third place or having the most intact ship, and then lose some credits for damaged components. Space can be a very dangerous place and it is not uncommon to see your ship break into smaller and smaller pieces or lose some very valuable cargo off the side. If your ship gets damaged too much you can get knocked out of the race, so be careful!

3 rounds of this are done, and in each round players get a bigger board to build a ship that can hold more components. After the 3rd round the player with the most credits wins!

rpgpodcastepisode.177172: Episode 47 - Lamentations of the Flame Princess

31481.name: Galaxy Trucker

31482.description:
The first chapter is the game. It covers all aspects of naval warfare during the American Civil War. Ramming, mines,
subs are also covered. The game is historical with one slight twist. It was written for what the ships were designed to do, not what they actually did. In this light two very powerful and equal fleets set sail. The players are the difference that decides the outcome.

The other chapters provide historical data to enrich the game. The original game has grown to be a one stop info source for the vessels of the ACW. For those without ship models.
110 different ships are provided on the cards on the CD. 90 vessels are drawn in black and white in Chapter 7. It also contains ACW photos of many of the ships. The game is design for all scales. Only four rules are different for the larger models, mainly distances.
31482.name: Brown Water Navies

31483.description:
In the 6th century A.D., ruled by Emperor Iustinianus (commonly called 'Justinian'), Constantinopolis was the largest emporium in the East Roman 'Byzantine' Empire. Built on the shore of the Marmara sea, at the entrance of the Bosporus (Hellispontus), its position let it take on the role of one of the most important harbors. Its quickly expanding trade and exports to close cities were great opportunities for the local businessmen to expand their riches.

Take on the role of an ambitious merchant during this golden era of trade. The task set before you is to become the most successful entrepreneur in the city of Constantinopolis. Compete against your rivals and earn the most renown by completing contracts and establishing viable trade; your fame will be measured by your ability to expand your trade district while managing your delivery contracts.

Constantinopolis is a board game of resource management, economy, and trade for 2-5 players. With a moderate game time of 1 to 2 hours and intuitive rules, Constantinopolis strikes the perfect balance of accessibility and depth.

Tiles in Latin, consistent with Giustiniano's time, are both a reference to the high period of Constantinopolis and a way to make the game entirely language independent.
31483.name: Constantinopolis

31484.name: The Weider Game
31484.description:
"The Weider Game - it's more than a game!"
An educational fitness game based on dice, trivia, and physical challenges. Game play is divided into two parts.

Events
The game begins with players trying to win medals in a series of events based mainly on dice rolls.

Weight Lifting - up to 3 dice rolls to gain the most points
Walking - dice roll race with some values given special meanings
Long Jump - simultaneous distance choice, identical numbers are canceled
High Jump - dice rolls for numbers higher than an incremental value
Sprint - dice roll race in turns





Weider Marathon
In the Weider Marathon players roll dice and move along the path. On trivia squares, players answer educational questions about nutrition, anatomy, and sports. Surprise squares often have the player trying to complete some physical task; some easy, some not. Medals are used to fulfill a difficult question or challenge. A player who retains a medal to the end does not have to finish with an exact dice roll.

31485.name: Tiamat
31485.description:
This is an abstract game that kind of resembles the old old video game "Snake" -- where you moved your snake around the screen eating blocks, and each block you ate lengthened your tail, making it harder to move.

But, your moving around a set of circular rings, collecting blocks that have different scoring values, in competition with everyone else collecting blocks that will grow your snake, and trying to end at the centre square with the most valuable snake you can get.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=18

31486.name: Node Ball
31486.description:
Node ball is an abstracted sports game, where you're trying to bounce one of three balls in the game through an opponents goal area. You have several pieces that can move in varying ways to "kick" the ball, which then roll as far as the kicking piece moved in the opposite direction. The game continues until all balls have scored, and the player with the most points wins.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=29

Online Play


Super Duper Games

31487.name: Selva
31487.description:
Played on a 13x13 Go board with go stones and 2 special stones each ("tigers"), the game is mostly about moving stones such that they bump opponents stones, with the hope to have them move past your tigers where they will get eaten. The winner is first to eat the opponents tiger or eat all the opponents stones, or immobilize the opponents tiger.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=34

Online Play


Super Duper Games

31488.name: Kaiju Grand Prix
31488.description:
You're racing giant monsters after a little rabbit -- first to catch the rabbit wins. Of course, you're a giant monster -- you can attack the other giant monsters, too. Each monster has custom abilities, and a variable number of actions depending on its "heart rate", which starts at 1, and goes up as things happen. You select as many dice as you have heart rate for different categories like attack, defense, or movement (simultaneously) then roll and evaluate. So, the higher the heart rate, the better -- except if your heart rate exceeds 10, you explode and lose the race.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=26

31489.name: Conversion
31489.description:
This game is similar to the Flash game Proximity (available many places, for example: http://www.mathsisfun.com/games/proximity.html ). Players roll a hand of 5 dice, then each in turn place them on a chess board. If a die is placed adjacent to dice of the same player, those dice are promoted in value. If placed adjacent to dice of another player, those dice are converted to the placing players color and raised one in value. Several winning conditions are given, including most points, most area, and other options based on these.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=23

Online Play


Super Duper Games

31490.name: Tris
31490.description:
Tris combines some of the ideas of Tetris and Connect 4, with the further idea of pushing stones and them falling. It is played on a chess board, and players alternate either placing stones or moving them. Place stones can be placed on either edge, or a at the top of a column of stones from an edge. Stones can be moved one space left or right into an unoccupied space, and if it is unsupported, they "fall" to the bottom. Four stones in a row of your color are "captured" and removed from the board, the remaining stones "fall", and if more 4-in-a-rows result, this recurses. Stones in a full row are locked. Winner is first to capture 12 of their own pieces, or to fill their side of the board with locked rows.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=37

31491.name: Planecrash
31491.description:
Planecrash is a game played with Magic: The Gathering cards, though it has almost nothing to do with that game. Players select a deck of cards of various colors (color determined based on M:TG rules), shuffle it, then play from the shuffled deck. The place a card on one of three piles based on color relationships, with the chance to capture a pile or create a particular combination of colors on top of the three piles. Creating the correct combination, or collecting the most cards, results in a win.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=30

31492.name: Thieves Guild
31492.description: The Thieves Guild is a game, where players act as thieves, rob themselves and compete who will collect the biggest number of gold coins.

31493.name: Mirrorwing
31493.description:
Mirrorwing is a game inspired by Chess but with some interesting twists. All pieces are, essentially, pawns ("villagers") at the start, but they can be stacked -- at which time they become a "dragonrider", with the movement based on the bottom piece ("dragon") and the attack/capture (which is done without moving to the capture location, unlike Chess) based on the top piece ("rider"). As an added twist, any piece that moves over the center line of the board flips over, reversing the dragon and rider abilities. Winner is the last player to have an un-enhanced (villager) piece remaining.

Full rules: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=28

31494.name: Shannon
31494.description: This is an abstract strategy game where players are rolling place dice onto a 4x4 chess-board like area. One player has light dice and the other dark -- and similarly there are light and dark squares on the board. The player with the highest score in their dice on the opposite toned squares wins. The trick comes in that the dice are placed with a particular horizontal or vertical orientation, and that when a dice is placed, adjacent dice may be converted if the facing side of the new die is higher in value than the facing side of the original die. Also, to give a bit more strategic depth, players may store up to 3 dice that they don't like the rolls on -- and may use one of these instead of rolling on any turn. But, they must use all the stored dice by game end.

31495.name: Pomota
31495.description:
Pomota -- for POstMOdern TActics is an abstract set of miniatures-like rules, using a chessboard as the playing field and (usually, though not required) chess pieces as the miniatures. It provides a set of rules for movement, combat, knock-out and elimination, and a points system for both evaluating wins and using the variable and specialized powers of the pieces.

Two possible "armies" are supplied, but it is clear that the idea is that this could be quite extensible.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=33

31496.name: Leave No Man Behind
31496.description: This is an abstract game played with a chess board and Icehouse Pieces where the object is to get your pieces to the opposite corner of the board as quickly as possible. It has some of the feel of Chinese Checkers, but with the added complications of the possibility of your opponent being able to immobilize your pieces, and you being able to carry your immobilized pieces, and movement rates and jumping restrictions based on the size of the pieces involved.

boardgamehonor.9282: 2008 Årets Spill Best Family Game Nominee

31497.description:
Taken from Boardgame News:

Oregon is a family/strategy game with a colonization-theme and a card-driven placement mechanism. The aim of the game is to position farmers and point-giving buildings in the best possible locations on the board.

The year is 1846. Gunslingers, lawmen, pioneers and whole families left their homes in the east and midwest to try their luck in the West. They loaded their covered wagons with all they could and headed west across steppes, deserts, and mountains. Many chose to settle in Oregon, where the farming and hunting was plentiful and they could stake out a bit of land for themselves.The players have already reached Oregon and gaze upon the rich farmland below and the potential gold and coal reserves of the mountains. They build ports on the lakes and rivers, churches, warehouses, post offices, and train stations on the plains. And, of course, they must farm the rich land to grow the food necessary for the area to grow and thrive. To win, a player must choose the right times to farm and the right times to build, for planning is necessary, even here in the untamed wilderness of Oregon!Oregon - the way the west was won ...
31497.name: Oregon

31498.name: Plastic Glory
31498.description:
Plastic Glory is, essentially, a simple miniatures rules system -- except it isn't for miniatures. You're fighting with plastic toy soldiers, they're marching across the tabletop, climbing over books, ducking around a Cheetos bag, etc. They move in inches, real inches -- not scale to something. They have capabilities based on the posture of the plastic figure -- standing, crouching, or prone.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=41

31499.name: Coatl
31499.description: Coatl is a race to get your pawns to the center of a spiral before your opponent(s), by rolling better. But, there are a couple twists -- the simple one is that landing on an opponent captures it, sending it back to the start. But, landing on your own piece allows you to combine them at which point they get enhanced powers, with a choice of what power to take. This combination is where the strategy comes in.

31500.name: White Collar Battle
31500.description:
Each player has a business card, in fact it should be a USA business card since zip-codes are mentioned in the rules. Each player will select some dice, and roll them -- trying to get sets. They can augment their sets by crossing out numbers on their business card, and they damage other players by knocking numbers on their opponents business cards. You're KOed if you have no numbers left, last card "standing" wins.

Full rules at: http://www.luchacabra.com/?p=40
